cars.name: Abarth 1500 Biposto Bertone B.A.T 1 '52
description: An aerodynamics test vehicle that was displayed at the 1952 Turin Motor Show. Based on a FIAT model, the car featured marvellously unique stylings by Franco Scaglione, and was equipped with a 1.5L engine tuned by Abarth to 73 BHP. The only example ever produced was later entered in the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance in recent years, winning the Gran Turismo trophy.

cars.name: Abarth Abarth 500 '09
description: A factory tuned model of the FIAT 500, produced by the legendary Italian tuning brand Abarth, who made a comeback in 2007. Equipped with a 1.4L DOHC turbo engine producing 133.1 BHP/21 kgfm and with a lightweight body weighing 1,110 kg, the car is able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in 7.9 seconds and has a top speed of 127.4 mph. The car also exhibits the indomitable image of an Abarth with big bumpers, side skirts and a roof-end spoiler.

cars.name: Abarth Abarth 595 SS '70
description: The FIAT Abarth 595 was introduced in 1963. It was based on the 2nd gen FIAT 500 and tuned by Abarth. A further tuned model of the 595 would debut as the 595 Esseesse. Though it used the same engine displacement, compression was increased to improve power output to 31.6 BHP. With this extra performance in hand, the 595 series would see use in racing series across Europe, where it took the under 600 cc class by storm.

cars.name: AFEELA AFEELA 1 '26
description: The AFEELA 1 was unveiled at CES® 2025. This production model is available in 2 trim levels, Origin and Signature. Featuring a luxurious interior styled as a Creative Entertainment Space, this BEV challenges previous concepts of travel. It features a wealth of advanced technologies such as sensing devices embedded in the exterior and a personal agent that is able to converse in natural speech.

cars.name: AFEELA AFEELA Prototype 2024
description: The AFEELA Prototype 2024 is a BEV unveiled by Sony Honda Mobility at CES® 2024. Numerous sensing devices provide natural driver assistance, while on the interior, displays on the dashboard and seat backs provide copious amounts of entertainment. The AFEELA transforms travelling from waiting into time well spent.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo 155 2.5 V6 TI '93
description: The 155 2.5 V6 TI was developed by Alfa Romeo for competition in the Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters (DTM) which had begun to allow major car modifications from 1993. Based on the '92 model 155 4-door sedan, the car is equipped with 60-degree V6 2.5L engine producing 414.2 BHP, and a full-time four-wheel drive system. It would win 12 of the 20 rounds, claiming a glorious title victory.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo 4C '14
description: Alfa Romeo's first mass production mid-engine sports car, released in 2013. The car takes much from the stylings of the classic Tipo 33/2 Stradale. The 1,742 cc 4-cylinder engine producing 236.7 BHP/35.7 kgfm is combined with an extremely light body, allowing the car to accelerate to 62.1 mph in 4.5 seconds with a top speed of 160.3 mph. The 'launch edition' was a special edition model, limited to 1000 cars worldwide.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo 4C Gr.3
description: The 4C Gr.3 is a Gran Turismo original model based on Alfa Romeo's new generation midship sports car, the 4C, modified to meet Gr.3 standards. Careful attention has been placed on the stability and aerodynamics with the wheelbase lengthened by 110 mm, and the front overhang by roughly 30 mm. The 4C has been reborn as a race car able to handle a great amount of power, while still retaining the excellent cornering ability of the original.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo 4C Gr.3 Road Car
description: A homologation model of the 4C Gr.3 which is based on Alfa Romeo's new generation midship sportscar, the 4C, modified to meet Gr.3 standards. The excellent cornering ability of the base model has been given a high-speed overhaul with power output increased from 200 to 450 horsepower, and a widened body.
cars.descriptionText: A homologation model of the 4C Gr.3 which is based on Alfa Romeo's new generation midship sportscar, the 4C, modified to meet Gr.3 standards. The excellent cornering ability of the base model has been given a high-speed overhaul with power output increased from 200 to 450 horsepower, and a widened body.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo 4C Gr.4
description: The 4C Gr.4 is a Gran Turismo original model based on Alfa Romeo's new generation midship sports car, the 4C, modified to meet Gr.4 standards. It is essentially a tuned version of the base model, so while it is somewhat lacking in power, this cornering monster uses the innate agility of its small frame to gain an advantage on track.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo 8C 2900B Touring Berlinetta '38
description: As its name might suggest, the Alfa Romeo 8C 2900B Touring Berlinetta is an exquisite coupé with bodywork produced by Carrozzeria Touring in their superleggera process. '8C' refers to the engine's 8 cylinders. The water cooled inline-8 engine was created by genius designer Vittorio Jano, and in performance terms pushes the car into racing car territory. It is believed that only 5 were produced in total.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo 8C Competizione '08
description: The original 8C was named for its 8-cylinder engine designed by genius Vittorio Jano. Behind its classical stylings lurks a 4.7L V8 engine tuned by Alfa Romeo to produce 443.8 BHP, with a top speed of 180.2 mph and a 0-62.1 mph time of under 4.2s, putting some contemporary supercars to shame. Released in a worldwide run of 500 units, it sold out almost immediately upon release.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo Giulia GTAm '20
description: In 2020, Alfa Romeo celebrated the 110th anniversary of their founding with the release of the 'GTA' and 'GTAm' special models of the Giulia. The output of the 2.9L V6 twin-turbo engine has been increased to 532.5 BHP, with further performance improvements in the form of weight reduction and an increased track width. The GTAm model is also designed with circuit use in mind, adding a large front splitter, carbon fibre rear wing and roll bars for a hardcore setup.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo Giulia Sprint GT Veloce '67
description: Introduced in 1962, the Alfa Romeo's first Giulia series started as a 4-door sedan, with the Sprint GT coupé model later added in 1963. Designed by Giugiaro, the body features smooth lines and gently curved surfaces. The Sprint GT became popular as a high performance sports coupé and remained in production until 1977.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo GIULIA TZ2 carrozzata da ZAGATO '65
description: This racing machine was born from the combined efforts of Alfa Romeo and Carrozzeria Zagato. Based on the TZ, the body shell has been replaced with FRP, and the nose and roof lowered to improve aerodynamics. The engine uses the twin ignition head from the Giulia GTA to produce 162.7 BHP, and a top speed of 152.2 mph.

cars.name: Alfa Romeo MiTo '09
description: A 3-door hatchback released in the B-segment to replace Alfa Romeo's previous entry-level model, the 147. The car's name is taken from Milano and Torino (Milan-Turin), two very important places in Alfa Romeo history. The standard power unit is a 1.4L DOHC turbo with the 1.4 Sport model producing 152.9 BHP/23 kgfm, coupled with a 6-speed manual transmission. With a top speed of 133.6 mph and a 0-62.1 mph time of 8.0 seconds, the car has more than just adequate performance for a car of its class.

cars.name: Alpine A110 '17
description: The classic Alpine A110 served admirably in rally racing the world over. In 2017 Renault revived the Alpine brand to continue the legend, unveiling the new generation Alpine A110. Featuring an aluminium body reminiscent of the classic A110, this new model houses a 1.8L 4-cylinder turbo engine in the midship position, producing 248.5 BHP/32 kgfm. The special 'Première Édition' was limited to 1955 cars worldwide.

cars.name: Alpine A110 '72
description: The Alpine A110 is a classic French sports car with a historic legacy in rally racing. Utilizing the excellent traction provided by the rear-engine layout and ultralight body, it took the international rallying scene by storm, racking up numerous victories. Originally debuting in 1963 with a 1.1L engine, the A110's displacement steadily grew over the years to keep up with the competition. The ultimate model is arguably the 1600S which featured a 1.6L engine.
cars.descriptionText: The Alpine A110 is a classic French sports car with a historic legacy in rally racing. The ultimate model is arguably the 1600S which featured a 1.6L engine.

cars.name: Alpine A220 Race Car '68
description: Thanks to the efforts of the A110, Alpine is well known as a rallying brand, but in the 1960s they also developed prototype racing cars which found success on the circuit. Of those, the car that had the greatest chance of overall victory at the 24 Hours of Le Mans was the A220 which debuted in 1968. In the actual race the car was plagued by troubles and unable to achieve the desired result, but it is still remembered by fans as one of the classic Alpines.

cars.name: Alpine Alpine VGT
description: A single-seater sports car designed by celebrated French brand Alpine for the players of Gran Turismo. Its style is based on the Alpine philosophy of 'speed and excitement, embodied in style' while at the same time being an homage to classic Alpines. This revolutionary vehicle bridges the gap between the road and the circuit, and the virtual and reality.

cars.name: AMG 300 SEL 6.8 AMG '71
description: This touring car was created by Mercedes-AMG in their earlier days. The 300 SEL 6.3 was already a very fast car, but with the engine enlarged to 6.8L and some extra tuning, the power output was greatly increased from 246.5 BHP to 422.1 BHP. In the 1971 24 Hours of Spa, it would claim victory in its class and 2nd overall, proving AMG's potential for racing.

cars.name: AMG A 45 AMG '13
description: This high-performance model was added to the 3rd generation A-Class line-up one year after its debut. The 2L turbo engine, tuned by AMG, produces 355 BHP/45 kgfm. The car goes from 0-62.1 mph in 4.6 seconds and hits its speed limiter at 155.3 mph. To keep this power under control, the car utilises a 7-speed dual-clutch transmission directed through a four-wheel drive system. Brakes and suspension components have also been upgraded.

cars.name: AMG Mercedes-AMG C 63 S '15
description: A high-performance model of the 4th generation C Class. Though it shares the same name as the previous C63, a few major changes have been made, including switching the naturally aspirated 6.2L V8 engine for a 4L twin-turbo configuration. This new engine is the same as the one used in the AMG GT, but the maximum torque has been increased and the range lowered to fit the weight and purpose of the vehicle. The 'C63 S Coupé' is a circuit-oriented performance model.

cars.name: AMG Mercedes-AMG GT Black Series '20
description: This ultimate sports car is one of several evolutions of the AMG GT that had come since its introduction in 2014. The 4L V8 engine has been specially tuned to increase both power and torque, reaching 719.9 BHP and 800Nm (81.57 kgfm) respectively. The construction and materials used in the suspension have also been overhauled for the best possible handling and cornering performance. Another selling point is its racing car style bodywork.

cars.name: AMG Mercedes-AMG GT R '17
description: A 'road-going race car' created from the AMG GT. The exterior features a wide body with stretched out fenders and an active aerodynamics system, while the front grille features strong vertical lines. The 4L V8 twin-turbo engine has been tuned to produce 576.9 BHP and 71.3 kgfm. This car is also notable for being the first Mercedes-AMG to feature four-wheel steering.

cars.name: AMG Mercedes-AMG GT S '15
description: The AMG GT is a supercar announced in 2014 by Mercedes-Benz. Under its characteristic long-nose stylings, lies a rigid aluminium space frame, carrying the M178 3,982 cc V8 twin-turbo engine. The 'S' is a high performance model that increases the power output to 502 BHP, and matches its performance with stiffer suspension and wider tyres.

cars.name: AMG Mercedes-AMG GT Safety Car
description: The AMG GT is a supercar announced in 2014 by Mercedes-Benz. Under its characteristic long-nose styling lies a rigid aluminium space frame, carrying the M178 3,982 cc V8 twin-turbo engine. The 'S' is a high performance model that increases the power output to 502 BHP. This particular model has been modified as a Safety Car.

cars.name: AMG Mercedes-AMG GT3 '16
description: The AMG GT3 is Mercedes-Benz's GT3 race car. Debuting in 2016, it competed in GT3 category races around the world. Its incredible performance allowed it to take places 1-4 in its first outing at the Nürburgring 24 Hours. One of its most successful users is HTP Motorsport who are regularly competing for the top spots in the Blancpain GT Series.

cars.name: AMG Mercedes-AMG GT3 '20
description: This FIA homologated GT3 racing car is based on the AMG GT. While performance and aerodynamic improvements have been made, another focus of the development was the running costs of client teams. This led to longer engine life and better radiator protection among other additions. In 2020, the EVO model was introduced alongside a facelift for the road car with other new features.

cars.name: AMG Mercedes-Benz AMG VGT
description: This car marked the opening of the 'Vision Gran Turismo' project. Its elegant form is styled after a large feline on the hunt, and is a hybrid of an aluminium space frame with carbon fibre. At 1,358 kg, the car is relatively light and is equipped with an AMG 5L V8 twin-turbo engine producing 430kW/800Nm (576.9 BHP/81.6 kgfm). The engine sound has also been tuned by specialists making this car as appealing to the ear as it is to the eye.

cars.name: AMG Mercedes-Benz AMG VGT Racing Series
description: A racing version of the Mercedes-Benz AMG Vision Gran Turismo. This car has done away with all the interior comforts to bring the weight down to 1,300 kg and generates more downforce for the circuit with a large fixed rear wing. The power of the AMG 5.5L V8 twin-turbo engine has been increased to 591.7 BHP. The transmission has also been optimised for transmission performance, leaving behind the 7-speed dual-clutch for a full sequential system.

cars.name: AMG SLS AMG '10
description: Unveiled at the 2009 Frankfurt Motor Show, this sports car features gull-wing doors. The all aluminium body houses a newly developed 6.3L V8 engine producing 563.1 BHP/66 kgfm. The 7-speed dual-clutch transmission has been unified with the rear-differential, and provides 5 driving modes to choose from. In performance terms, the car goes from 0-62.1 mph in 3.8 seconds and is able to reach a top speed of 197 mph.

cars.name: AMG SLS AMG Gr.4
description: The SLS supercar is an homage to historic Mercedes designs. This version modified for Gr.4 is a Gran Turismo Original. With its GT3 style roll cage, long nose and short deck, its dimensions are similar to the 300SL and provide good cornering stability. The straight line speed provided by its conventional V8 engine should not be ignored either.

cars.name: AMG SLS AMG GT3 '11
description: The SLS AMG GT3 is a GT3 regulation race car based on the SLS AMG. It uses the same basic power unit as the production model. While power figures have not been officially announced, it is estimated to produce over 591.7 BHP. This car began full scale racing competition from 2011, winning 25 of the 101 races it was used in that year.

cars.name: Amuse Amuse NISMO 380RS Super Leggera
description: The Version NISMO Type 380RS is a complete tuned car based on the Z33 Fairlady Z built by NISMO. Power House Amuse tuned this car even further, to create the Amuse NISMO 380RS Super Leggera. The most notable improvement is the 140 kg weight reduction, as implied by the 'Super Leggera' monicker, which means superlight in Italian.

Power House Amuse tuned this car even further, to create the Amuse NISMO 380RS Super Leggera. The most notable improvement is the 140 kg weight reduction, as implied by the 'Super Leggera' monicker, which means superlight in Italian.

cars.name: Amuse Amuse S2000 GT1 Turbo
description: Known for their extensive know-how for tuning the S2000, Power House Amuse's ultimate achievement is the S2000 GT1. Made of carbon fibre, the car's body kit was developed in collaboration with Polyphony Digital. Though the car's width has increased to 1,829 mm, its weight has been reduced to approximately 1,120 kg. The engine has also been improved, achieving a power-to-weight ratio of only 1.79 kg per 1 horsepower.
cars.descriptionText: Known for their extensive know-how for tuning the S2000, Power House Amuse's ultimate achievement is the S2000 GT1. cars.name: Aston Martin DB11 '16
description: Unveiled at the 2016 Geneva Motor Show, this is the quintessential Aston Martin. While keeping the silhouette that the company is known for, this car separates itself from cars of the past with its new modern details. The engine is a newly developed 5.2L V12 twin-turbo producing 599.6 BHP/71 kgfm and with the ZF 8-speed automatic transmission, the DB11 is able to reach supercar speeds with a 0-62.1 mph acceleration of 3.9 seconds and a top speed of 206.3 mph.

cars.name: Aston Martin DB3S '53
description: A staple of the 1950s racing scene. Starting from the base DB3, the wheelbase has been shortened and the body weight reduced, along with aerodynamic modifications. The inline-6 engine originally produced 224.9 BHP but has been tuned to eventually reach 239.6 BHP. This car won the 'Gran Turismo Trophy' at Pebble Beach in 2013.

cars.name: Aston Martin DB5 '64
description: The DB5 is a sports car by Aston Martin introduced in 1963. It was designed by Italy's Carrozzeria Touring using superleggera construction to reduce body weight. The engine produced 281.1 BHP on the standard model with the Vantage producing 313.6 BHP. It has been lauded as one of the super sports cars of the early 1960s. It also gained fame as the one of the 'Bond cars' featured in the 007 film series.

cars.name: Aston Martin DBR9 GT1 '10
description: The Aston Martin DBR9 GT1 was produced from 2005 by Aston Martin Racing for the GT1 category and is based on the DB9. The body has been lightened with carbon fibre construction and features a 5.9L V12 engine mated to a 6-speed sequential transmission. In its debut race, it claimed victory at the 12 Hours of Sebring and then went on to win the GT1 class at the 24 Hours of Le Mans twice, running in 2007 and 2008.

The body has been lightened with carbon fibre construction and features a 5.9L V12 engine mated to a 6-speed sequential transmission. In its debut race, it claimed victory at the 12 Hours of Sebring and then went on to win the GT1 class at the 24 Hours of Le Mans twice, running in 2007 and 2008.

cars.name: Aston Martin DP-100 VGT
description: This Vision Gran Turismo design was born from the minds of Marek Reichman's design team at Aston Martin. The car was developed in the same processes as production cars at the company's headquarters in Gaydon, Warwickshire. The engine is an 800 BHP (799.8 BHP) V12 twin turbo. The DP-100 also serves as a pilot model for Aston Martin technologies and designs of the future.

cars.name: Aston Martin One-77 '11
description: This is Aston Martin's new flagship model released in 2009. While visually similar to the DB9 and DBS, the car is actually a special model developed almost from scratch. The power unit is a 7.3L V12 jointly developed with Cosworth, and is the most powerful naturally aspirated engine released for a production car with an output of 749.5 BHP/76 kgfm. Originally announced for sale in the UK at 1,200,000 pounds, all 77 cars sold in one year after delivery started at the beginning of 2011.

cars.name: Aston Martin V12 Vantage GT3 '12
description: A pure racing machine which began competing in GT races in 2012, continuing the glorious track record built up by its predecessors the DBR9 and DBRS9. Built off of the V8 Vantage body, the fenders have been widened and a large rear wing has been added, while the weight has been shaved down to just 1,250 kg. The V12 engine has been tuned to 591.7 BHP/71 kgfm and mated to an XTrac sequential transmission with paddle shifters. The car would go on to perform spectacularly at circuits around the world.

cars.name: Aston Martin V8 Vantage Gr.4
description: This Gran Turismo Original takes Aston Martin's mid-range 'Vantage' sports car and modifies it to meet Gr.4 regulations. The lively V8 engine's straight line speed and the excellent cornering behaviour inherent in the car's ideal weight distribution make for a well-balanced racing machine.

cars.name: Aston Martin V8 Vantage S '15
description: The 'Baby Aston' was developed to offer the best performance possible. While this front-engine, rear-wheel drive sports car originally debuted in 2005 equipped with a 4.3L V8 engine, in 2008 engine displacement was increased to 4.7L for increased performance. The Vantage S was a special high-performance model introduced in 2011. Along with a high output engine, it also featured stiffer suspension and a more aggressive steering ratio for sharper sports driving.

cars.name: Aston Martin Valkyrie '21
description: The Valkyrie hypercar was jointly developed by Red Bull Racing and Aston Martin. The front wing is suspended under the high nosed front section, while the whole underbody acts as a tunnel to produce tremendous downforce. The car is equipped with a 6.5L naturally aspirated V12 engine with KERS (kinetic energy recovery system) in a hybrid configuration. With a total system output of 1,139 BHP, the Valkyrie is close to top category racing machines in performance.

cars.name: Aston Martin Vantage '18
description: The Vantage proved to be a hit as a performance rear-wheel drive sports car. The model introduced in 2017 was almost identical in construction to the DB11 V8, but had a short wheelbase and was roughly 120 kg lighter, which gained it critical acclaim as the best handling car in corners in Aston Martin history. The engine is a Mercedes-AMG derived 4L V8 twin-turbo unit capable of a top speed of 195 mph (195.1 mph).

cars.name: Aston Martin Vulcan '16
description: A special circuit-only model limited to a production of 24 cars, the car was developed based on the experience gained from the One-77. The front midship mounted 7L V12 engine produces 799.8 BHP, transmitted through the transaxle transmission. Damping, ABS and TCS can all be adjusted to the preference of the driver. Each lucky owner receives complete technical support from Aston Martin, and a dedicated circuit driving program is also provided.

cars.name: Audi Audi e-tron VGT
description: Audi Design's electric powered Vision Gran Turismo. All across the vehicle, elements taken from Audi's circuit legend, the 90 IMSA GTO are clearly visible. The car features a four-wheel drive system actuated by 3 electric motors, 1 in the front and 2 in the rear, for a total system power output of 600kW (803.7 BHP). Audi Sport constructed a fully functioning e-tron which would go on to exhibit its overwhelming potential at circuits around the world.

cars.name: Audi Audi VGT
description: A Vision Gran Turismo car created by Audi Design. Two versions were envisioned, one hybrid, one EV. On the hybrid, the rear wheels are powered by a 3.4L V6 turbo engine while the front wheels are connected to an electric motor/generator unit, which combined produce an astonishing 950kW (1,274.2 BHP). The car's appearance is based on the classic Audi 90 IMSA GTO race car.

cars.name: Audi R18 '16
description: The Audi R18 was developed to compete in the 2016 World Endurance Championship (WEC). The aerodynamics were overhauled, changing to an F1 style narrow nose with wing, and the regenerative energy output was increased from 4MJ to 6MJ. Though Audi managed to secure 2nd place in the Constructors title, unfortunately Audi decided to withdraw from the WEC at the end of the season.

cars.name: Audi R18 TDI '11
description: A prototype racing car developed by Audi. Though similar to the diesel-powered R10 and R15, the R18 is different in that it is Audi's first closed body design since 1999's R8C. The engine is less powerful than other recent machines producing only 532.5 BHP but is able to make up for it with extensive weight reduction and the aerodynamic advantages that come with a closed body. In 2011, the car took the overall victory at the Le Mans.

cars.name: Audi R8 4.2 '07
description: While developed from the 'Le Mans quattro' concept car, the production version of this sports car was named for Audi's R8 race cars which had performed spectacularly at Le Mans. Made with Audi's ultra lightweight space frame, the car is equipped with a 414.2 BHP 4.2L V8 engine driving all four wheels through the quattro system which uses viscous couplings. In 2009, the 5.2 FSI was added to the line-up equipped with a 5.2L V10 producing 517.7 BHP.

In 2009, the 5.2 FSI was added to the line-up equipped with a 5.2L V10 producing 517.7 BHP.

cars.name: Audi R8 Coupé V10 plus '16
description: The second generation model of Audi's road car that carries the name of their prototype race car that competed in the 24 Hours of Le Mans. This new model carries over the image of its predecessor while updating the Audi space frame construction and 'quattro' four-wheel drive system. This V10 Plus is a high performance model which further tunes the 5.2L V10 engine to 601.6 BHP. It also features a fixed rear wing and a mechanical LSD as standard.

cars.name: Audi R8 LMS '15
description: The production model Audi R8 received a full model change in 2015 and along with it came an updated R8 LMS FIA GT3 specification racing car. Along with major improvements to safety and aerodynamics, the transmission and traction control were replaced with newly developed systems. Just after its announcement, the R8 LMS made its racing debut in the Nürburgring 24 Hours where it took overall victory.

cars.name: Audi R8 LMS Evo '19
description: An evolution model of the R8 LMS. Cooling and aerodynamics have been improved over the R8 LMS, while the entire drivetrain has been upgraded to increase reliability in competition. Engine power itself has not changed, but body weight has been reduced by 25 kg, allowing for extra freedom in weight balance when adding ballast. Debuting in autumn 2018, it would soon prove its potential by winning the Gulf 12 Hours at the end of the year.

cars.name: Audi RS 5 Turbo DTM '19
description: A 2019 Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters (DTM) car. Following engine downsizing rules introduced in Class 1, the engine has been changed from a 4L V8 to a 2L inline-4 turbo unit. This actually produced more power than the previous engine, and also offered benefits in weight and weight distribution. In the 2019 season, ace driver René Rast claimed the championship title along with the team title.

cars.name: Audi Sport quattro S1 Pikes Peak '87
description: Audi took the rally world by storm when they entered their full-time four-wheel drive technology into the 1981 World Rally Championship. This particular model is a version of the Sports quattro S1 rally car modified for hill climb competitions, featuring extremely aggressive ground effects. In 1987, Walter Rohrl would take this car to a record-breaking victory at the Pikes Peak International Hill Climb.

cars.name: Audi TT Coupé 3.2 quattro '03
description: The Audi TT is a sports coupé released in 1998. The base model featured the same 177.5 BHP 1.8L inline-4 DOHC turbo engine as the Audi A3 and A4, with upper grades featuring higher tuned versions of the same engine. In 2003, the 3.2 quattro was added to the lineup, equipped with a 3.2L V6 engine producing 246.5 BHP. This was mated to a new generation 2-pedal manual 'DSG' (Direct Shift Gearbox) transmission.

cars.name: Audi TT Cup '16
description: A racing car based on the Audi TT produced for the 'Audi Sport TT Cup' one-make race. Parts of the body shell have been replaced with carbon fibre and all driver comforts have been removed to bring the weight down to just 1,125 kg. The engine is a 305.7 BHP 2L 4-cylinder unit, the same as the normal TTS, but it also includes a 'push to pass' feature that allows it to produce an extra 29.6 BHP for a limited amount of time.

cars.name: Audi TTS Coupé '09
description: The TTS is a high performance model of the TT series which debuted in 2008. The powertrain uses a 2L direct injection turbo engine with a 6-speed manual, or 6-speed S-Tronic transmission. The engine block, pistons and conrods are all unique to the TTS, and the turbocharger has also been upgraded to deal with the extra power. The drivetrain uses Audi's proprietary full-time four-wheel drive system and is capable of a 0-62.1 mph time of 5.2s on the S-Tronic model and 5.4s on the manual.

cars.name: Audi TTS Coupé '14
description: The 3rd generation TT debuted in 2014. While still carrying the same concepts as the first two generations, the car was given a fiercer appearance with a larger single-frame grille and R8 style headlights. The TTS model is the leading sports model of the line-up and is equipped with the 4-cylinder turbo 2.0 TFSI engine tuned up to 309.7 BHP/38 kgfm (for the German domestic model.) With a 6-speed manual transmission linked to the quattro system, the car offers an incredible ride.

cars.name: Autobianchi A112 Abarth '85
description: Debuting in 1971, the A112 Abarth is often considered one of the original hot hatches. It is based on the Autobianchi A112 and has been tuned by Abarth. It received a number of updates with the engine displacement increased in 1975, raising power output to 70 BHP, and an upgrade to a 5-speed transmission in 1979. Production ended in 1985, but it would find long-lasting support from enthusiasts enamoured with its spirited character.

cars.name: BAC Mono '16
description: This car was built by Britain's Briggs Automotive Company to create 'a road vehicle that offers the most authentic and pure driving experience.' The one-seater chassis uses a tubular frame with a carbon fibre shell and is equipped with a Cosworth-tuned 2.5L Ford Duratec engine. Extremely lightweight at just 580 kg, it can accelerate from 0-60mph in just 2.8s and has a top speed of 170.3 mph, specs to rival an F3 car.

cars.name: BMW 3.0 CSL '71
description: In 1968, BMW released the 2800 CS sports coupé which featured a powerful 2.8 straight six engine. In 1971 came the 3.0 CS, an updated model with a larger engine. Having decided to enter the 3.0 CS in races, BMW developed a lightweight model for homologation purposes named the 3.0 CSL. The 'L' of this name stands for 'light.'

cars.name: BMW 3.0 CSL '73
description: The 3.0 CSL was introduced in 1971 as a racing homologation model of the BMW 3.0 CS, a sports coupé with a powerful 3L straight six engine. The engine displacement was increased from 2,985 cc to 3,003 cc in 1972, and again to 3,155 cc in 1973 in evolution models which saw incredible success on the European touring car scene.

cars.name: BMW BMW VGT
description: A modern road racer created by the BMW design team. Its exterior has been designed to give an incredible sense of speed even when the car is standing still. The engine is a powerful 3L straight six producing 404kW/680Nm (541.4 BHP/69 kgfm). Considerably light at only 1,180 kg, the car also achieves a perfect 50:50 front to rear weight distribution. This Vision Gran Turismo is a stunning amalgam of BMW's racing heritage and their latest technology.

This Vision Gran Turismo is a stunning amalgam of BMW's racing heritage and their latest technology.

cars.name: BMW i3 '15
description: An electric vehicle unveiled by BMW in 2013. The boxy, 4-door body features small pillarless rear doors and weighs just 1,195 kg thanks to the use of aluminium alloys for the chassis with carbon fibre for the cabin. The motor produces 167.7 BHP/25 kgfm, and from a standing start the car can reach 37.3 mph in 3.7 seconds and 62.1 mph in just 7.2 seconds. With a top speed of over 93.2 mph, this car can definitely stand up to its rivals powered by internal combustion engines.

cars.name: BMW M2 Competition '18
description: This ferocious beast puts the S55 3L straight six twin-turbo engine from the M3/M4 in the 2 Series coupé body. The stretched out fenders hint at the power within, but just a short sprint is enough to fully unleash its power as the turbochargers spool up. The suspension uses aluminium components to reduce unsprung weight. The torque vectoring Active M Differential allows the car to conquer any corner at will.

cars.name: BMW M3 '03
description: The 3rd M3 was introduced for the E46 model 3 Series. The 3.2L S54 straight six engine produces over 98.6 BHP per litre, reaching a maximum 338.3 BHP at 7,900 rpm. In 2003, the high performance CSL model was introduced. Along with replacing the roof with carbon fibre to reduce weight, the engine has also been tuned to produce 355 BHP. This car would see great success in touring car racing and other events.

cars.name: BMW M3 '07
description: The M3 has appeared across several generations of the 3 Series, pitched as a high performance model with strong links to motorsport. The E92 model combines a 7-speed DCT transmission with a 4L V8 engine producing 414.2 BHP. Extensive efforts have been made to reduce the weight of the larger body with the road car weighing just 1,630 kg. It is able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in 4.8s.
cars.descriptionText: The M3 has appeared across several generations of the 3 Series, pitched as a high performance model with strong links to motorsport. cars.name: BMW M3 '89
description: This homologation model was developed from the 3 Series model at the time for the purpose of competing in touring car racing. Using the 2-door sedan model as a base, the track width was increased and aerodynamic improvements were made including adjusting the angle of the rear wing. Starting with a 2.3L inline-4 DOHC engine, changes were made each year eventually resulting in the final 2.5L 'Sport Evolution' model.

cars.name: BMW M3 '97
description: The second M3 model was based on the E36 model 3 Series. While the original bore the trademarks of a competition car, this model was styled as grand tourer. Along with the addition of a straight six engine, a number of body styles were available including a 2-door, 4-door and cabriolet model. Originally a 3L engine, the 1995 model increased this to 3.2L, and introduced a 6-speed manual transmission alongside a 2-pedal SMG option.

cars.name: BMW M3 GT '11
description: This GT model is based on the high-performance M3, and has been modified for racing. Many of the body panels have been replaced with carbon fibre, reducing the weight to 1,245 kg, and the fenders have been stretched out increasing the body width by 110 mm. Even with the restrictor in place, the 4L V8 engine still produces 493.1 BHP.

cars.name: BMW M3 Sport Evolution '89
description: A coupé designed for touring car racing, based on the E30 model 3-series and developed by BMW M. The car adds blister fenders, front and rear spoilers and side skirts to create an all-new striking appearance. The Sport Evolution is the final model of this M3. It's bigger 2.5L engine produces 234.7 BHP/24 kgfm and would prove itself to be a fearsome presence on the circuit.

cars.name: BMW M4 '14
description: The 3-series coupé and cabriolet models were separated from the line-up to become the 4-series, with this car as the flagship model. While highly appealing for it's beautiful 2-door coupé proportions alone, the real focus of this car is on performance. The engine is a straight six twin-turbo producing 425 BHP/56.1 kgfm. The combination of the active M differential, adaptive M suspension and the M-specific DSC create the ultimate driving experience.

cars.name: BMW M4 Gr.4
description: This Gran Turismo Original takes BMW's new-generation high-performance M4 coupé and modifies it to meet Gr.4 regulations. A proven performer, it manages to retain the cornering ability and stability that BMW is known for despite its touring car style appearance. Its excellent drivability means that even new drivers should have no problem keeping it on track.

cars.name: BMW M4 Safety Car
description: This Gran Turismo Original safety car is based on BMW's new generation high performance M4 coupé. The exterior takes the 'M Performance Edition' and adds a number of specially designed parts, including a lip spoiler, bonnet pins, grill garnishes, rear spoiler and diffuser.
cars.descriptionText: This Gran Turismo Original safety car is based on BMW's new generation high performance M4 coupé. The exterior takes the 'M Performance Edition' and adds a number of specially designed parts, including a lip spoiler, bonnet pins, grill garnishes, rear spoiler and diffuser.

cars.name: BMW M6 GT3 Endurance Model '16
description: BMW announced that they would be competing with this M6 GT3 in the FIA GT3 category starting 2016. At 5m long and 2m wide, it is somewhat larger than its racing predecessor, the compact Z4 GT3. Gran Turismo series producing Kazunori Yamauchi competed in the Nürburgring 24 Hours in the Walkenhorst Motorsport M6 GT3, completing the race in 22nd overall.

cars.name: BMW M6 GT3 Sprint Model '16
description: The successor to the Z4 GT3 which had been BMW's mainstay GT3 race car since 2010. In contrast to the compact Z4, this car has a more opposing stature, measuring roughly 5 m long and over 2 m wide. The engine is a 4.4L V8 with twin turbos and produces 576.9 BHP on stock settings. The body is made mostly from carbon fibre and the frame and suspension have received a complete design overhaul, making this car considerably different from consumer model M6.

cars.name: BMW McLaren F1 GTR Race Car '97
description: Masterminded by Gordon Murray, this car is a racing version of the 'road-going F1' high performance sports car, F1. From its debut in 1995, steady improvements were made each year with this aerodynamically superior long tail version introduced in 1997. The car would have a relatively long lifespan as a race car, continuing to compete on the forefront under privateer teams up until 2003.

cars.name: BMW Z4 3.0i '03
description: The Z4 is a convertible sports car that debuted in 2002 to replace the Z3. The bodywork is notable for its clean fender lines and the characteristic Z shape press line ahead of the door. It boasts roughly 3 times as much torsional rigidity as the Z3 while reducing weight by 25 kg. It also features a number of new technologies, being the first BMW to feature electric power steering.

cars.name: BMW Z4 GT3 '11
description: Based on the E89 model Z4, BMW's GT3 machine began racing in 2010. The weight was reduced by 300 kg through modifications such as replacing the retractable roof with a fixed panel. The engine was also switched out for a 4L V8. The 2011 model added wider fenders and a larger 4.4L engine producing 507.9 BHP. Along with an upgraded paddle shift transmission, this Z4 was able to achieve a number of outstanding results in some of the most hotly contested races.

cars.name: BMW Z8 '01
description: This luxury convertible sports car takes cues from the classic '507' of the 1950s. The aluminium space frame houses the same 5L V8 engine and 6-speed transmission as the E39 model M5, producing 394.5 BHP and able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in 4.7s. It featured in a 007 movie as the Bond car.

cars.name: Bugatti Bugatti VGT
description: This machine was envisioned as an homage to cars of Bugatti's racing past. Designers and engineers came together to create the vehicle using the latest technologies and aerodynamic theory. With 4 turbochargers, the W16 engine produces an unbelievable 1230kW/1580Nm (1,649.9 BHP/161.1 kgfm) which makes it possible to reach speeds of over 248.5 mph (250mph) in four places on Circuit de la Sarthe, the home of the 24 Hours of Le Mans. The power bestowed upon the car allows it to reach a top speed of 278.1 mph (278mph).

cars.name: Bugatti Bugatti VGT (Gr.1)
description: A version of the Bugatti Vision Gran Turismo concept car, developed in a collaboration between Gran Turismo and Bugatti, modified for Gr.1 regulations. The excellent stability resulting the wide track and four-wheel drive system of the base model makes for a relatively easy-going race car.

cars.name: Bugatti Chiron '16
description: The Chiron is a super sports car by Bugatti, introduced in 2016. Sold in worldwide limited run of 500 cars, this car effectively serves as the successor to the Veyron. The carbon fibre chassis exhibits the same level of rigidity as an LMP1 race car, and the 8L W16 quad-turbo engine from the Veyron has been tuned to produce 1,479.3 BHP with 163.1 kgfm max. torque. It is able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in 2.5s and a prototype model set an actual top speed of 304.8 mph.

cars.name: Bugatti Veyron 16.4 '13
description: The ultimate supersports car. First unveiled in 2005 at the Tokyo Motor Show, the car boasted numbers rarely seen even among supercars: 987.2 BHP and a top speed of 252.9 mph, with a price tag of 1 million Euros. The engine is an 8L W16 design with four turbochargers, connected to a 7-speed DSG. A special key is required in order to engage the top speed mode, allowing the car to travel above 233 mph.

cars.name: Bugatti Veyron Gr.4
description: Bugatti's Veyron supercar has been modified to meet Gr.4 regulations for this Gran Turismo Original. Though the power output has been reduced from the base model for Gr.4 rules, it is still able to stand up to all rivals with its straight-line speed. It also has an advantage in the corners thanks to its four-wheel drive stability.

cars.name: BVLGARI BVLGARI Aluminium VGT
description: The BVLGARI Aluminium Vision Gran Turismo was inspired by the 'BVLGARI Aluminium' which revolutionised the wristwatch world in 1998, sharing the same spirit: sporty, smart and essential, yet precise. The timeless and unique design expresses innovative conceptual spirit and style, while fully realising the BVLGARI design DNA, transcending short-term trends and fashions.

cars.name: Chaparral 2J '70
description: The Chaparral 2J is an unusual race car that competed in the 1970 SCCA Can-Am series. It was nicknamed the 'vacuum cleaner' for its unique construction that places 2 fans in the rear of the body. Driven by a secondary engine, these 2 fans pull air out from underneath the car with a strong suction force. Effectively, this was the world's first active ground effect car. However, a change in SCCA regulations for 1971 banned the use of any secondary engines, forcing the car into retirement.

cars.name: Chaparral Chaparral 2X VGT
description: Chaparral is a legendary brand which has created a number of unique race cars, and the 2X is unlike anything ever seen before. The driver is encapsulated in the carbon fibre body, lying head first as if floating several centimetres off the track surface. The car is powered by an unprecedented laser pulse system which uses the rapid expansion of air to create both thrust and downforce.

cars.name: Chevrolet Camaro SS '16
description: The 6th generation of the Camaro debuted in 2015. The exterior retains the retro-modern concept of the previous generation but the interior structure is an all-new design. Based on the new 'Alpha' platform, aluminium is used throughout the car for a 28% increase in rigidity and a 90 kg decrease in weight. The SS sports grade model is equipped with a 6.2L V8 engine, with 20-inch wheels and Brembo brakes as standard.

cars.name: Chevrolet Camaro Z28 '69
description: The original Ford Mustang was an unprecedented hit when it was introduced as a compact sports coupé. Aiming to best Ford's success, Chevrolet developed the Camaro as a rival, introducing it in autumn 1966. The 'Z28' is a high performance model that shows the Camaro at its best. This special model features a larger displacement engine and an upgraded chassis in alignment with the regulations of the 'Trans-Am' production cars based on racing vehicles.
cars.descriptionText: The original Ford Mustang was an unprecedented hit when it was introduced as a compact sports coupé. This special model features a larger displacement engine and an upgraded chassis in alignment with the regulations of the 'Trans-Am' production cars based on racing vehicles.

cars.name: Chevrolet Camaro ZL1 1LE Package '18
description: The 6th generation Chevrolet Camaro was released in 2015. The most powerful model in the lineup was this ZL1, which uses the same supercharged 5.7L V8 'LT4' engine as the Corvette Z06. This produces 649.9 BHP with 89.8 kgfm torque. Furthermore, a 2018 model with the '1LE' performance package, which upgrades the suspension and drivetrain parts, set a time of 7:16.04 on the Nürburgring, surpassing many supercars.

cars.name: Chevrolet Chevelle SS 454 '70
description: The Chevelle was introduced in the year 1964 as Chevrolet's first intermediate model. The Chevelle also featured the 'SS' sports grade, which would eventually become the most powerful production intermediate model with the release of the 1970 model. The SS 454 was equipped with the LS6 engine, most powerful engine in the history of American cars by catalogue statistics at the time. This made the SS 454 one of the most reliable contenders on the drag racing circuit.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette (C1) '58
description: In the early 1950s, the American sports car market was largely dominated by European models. This was when Chevrolet would release the original Corvette. The very first models featured an advanced body design with a steel frame and fibreglass panels, equipped with a 149.9 BHP 3.8L straight six engine. While originally only produced in a limited run of 300 units, the car would prove to be a massive success and full scale production began in 1954. The power output was increased to 152.9 BHP and the 1958 model introduced the quad headlights.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette (C2) '63
description: This car is the reason the Corvette became the king of American sports cars. The futuristic yet elegant stingray inspired body took the world by storm. Its performance is also outstanding with a 5.4L OHV V8 engine producing over 295.9 BHP, along with 4-wheel independent suspension and a short wheelbase.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette C7 '14
description: The 'Stingray' name made a comeback with the 7th generation Corvette. The body uses lightweight materials and even with the 6.2L V8 LT1 achieves a front:rear weight distribution close to 50:50, the gold standard for the world's best cars. The Z51 performance package adds an electronic LSD, dry sump oil system, and integral brakes among other features which all together allow the car to go from 0-60mph (0-62.1 mph) in just 3.8 seconds.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette C7 Gr.3
description: This Gran Turismo Original modifies the C7, the final front-engine Corvette, to meet Gr.3 regulations. The exterior features large fog lamps for endurance racing, and an unusually shaped rear wing. The acceleration of the large displacement V8 and the agile cornering ability of the front-midship layout result in a textbook example of what an 'FR' race car should be.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette C7 Gr.3 Road Car
description: A homologation model of the C7 Gr.3, a version of the C7, the final front-engine Corvette modified for Gr.3 standards. This car is notable for its striking exterior which fully utilizes the 2,050 mm width restrictions of Gr.3. Looking towards its performance, the large body betrays its true nature as a cornering machine, able to make quick, nimble movements thanks to its race car style suspension.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette C7 Gr.4
description: This Gran Turismo Original modifies the C7, the final front-engine Corvette, to meet Gr.4 regulations. The predictable cornering characteristics of the base car make for a driver friendly experience. It also has superb straight line speed, so drivers should have no trouble keeping up with the competition anywhere on the track.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette C7 ZR1 '19
description: The ZR1 was introduced towards the end of the C7 Corvette's run becoming the most powerful version. The 6.2L V8 supercharged 'LT5' engine now produced 754.4 BHP/969 Nm (98.8 kgfm). Aero parts were developed in conjunction with Pratt & Miller Engineering who ran the C7 in GT races, released in a lap time focused set or a top speed focused set. A car equipped with the top speed set was able to reach 214.9 mph.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette C8 '20
description: Released in 2019, the eighth generation Corvette became the very first in the line to use a midship layout, a major change to the powertrain. The new 6.2L V8 'LT2' produced 495.1 BHP/65.0 kgfm and was attached to an 8-speed dual clutch transmission. While it lost the iconic long nose, it performed incredibly in its main category of GT racing with its modern performance characteristics.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette Convertible (C3) '69
description: The 3rd generation Corvette debuted in the autumn of 1967. Heavily influenced by Chevrolet's 1965 show model, the Mako Shark II, the new Corvette sported a glamorous new coupé body, often referred to as the 'coke bottle' look. At its debut, the car was simply called the Corvette, but in 1969 the car revived the Stingray name and brought with it a bigger engine giving the car a lot more flexibility.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette CX Concept '25
description: The Corvette CX Concept is an all-wheel drive electric hypercar. The fan-powered downforce system balances downforce across the front and rear of the car through fighter jet style thrust vector control. This allows for effective control of the over 2000 horsepower produced by its 4 electric motors. Designed to feel at home on the roads as on the track, this car is a vision of the future of American sports cars.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette CX.R VGT Concept
description: The Corvette CX.R Vision Gran Turismo Concept is a track-only model based on the Corvette CX Concept. This car has superior aerodynamics to the base CX Concept, with a much lower ride height. It is powered by a hybrid system that combines e-fuels with electric power, securing the high performance and range required for endurance racing.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette Stingray (C3) '69
description: The 1968 Corvette Stingray inherits its design from the 'Mako Shark II' concept car which reimagined the Corvette as a grand tourer. In 1969, the base model engine size was increased from 327ci to 350ci, though it retained the 295.9 BHP power figure. The next year saw the introduction of the 364.9 BHP LT1 engine and this version was lauded as the best handling of all the C3 Corvettes.
cars.descriptionText: The 1968 Corvette Stingray inherits its design from the 'Mako Shark II' concept car which reimagined the Corvette as a grand tourer. In 1969, the base model engine size was increased from 327ci to 350ci, though it retained the 295.9 BHP power figure. The next year saw the introduction of the 364.9 BHP LT1 engine and this version was lauded as the best handling of all the C3 Corvettes.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette Stingray Racer Concept '59
description: The original Chevrolet Corvette won numerous races. The Corvette SS, newly designed in a project led by GM engineer Zora Duntov, featured a fuel injection 364.9 BHP 283 engine and had a top speed of 181.4 mph. However, after a major incident in NASCAR, the AMA banned factory racing teams and the project was halted. The Stingray Racer was introduced as the successor to the SS and would go on to win the SCCA Class C modified title in 1959 and 1960.
cars.descriptionText: The original Chevrolet Corvette won numerous races. cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette Z06 (C5) '01
description: The hardtop model added to the Corvette C5 line-up in 1999 utilized the increased body rigidity to improve performance. What's more is the coupé model was priced lower than the standard model, leading to widespread support from enthusiasts. Performance was increased even further in 2001, this evolved Z06 model invoked the image of the C2 and boasted the fastest top speed for a production car.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette ZR-1 (C4) '89
description: The ZR-1 was a special performance package introduced for the Corvette in 1990. At its core is the 'LT5' engine, which uses an aluminium-alloy cylinder block with a DOHC 4-valve head, jointly developed between Chevrolet and Lotus. While the standard engine produced 246.5 BHP, this new unit produced 374.8 BHP. Its sale price was double that of the standard Corvette, making it a very expensive model, but even so it is rumoured that Chevrolet made very little profit from it.

cars.name: Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 (C6) '09
description: From the introduction of the C6 Z06 in 2005 onwards, the Chevrolet Corvette has exhibited not just the style, but the performance level of a supercar. The 2008 ZR1 rivalled its competitors from Ferrari and Lamborghini in performance. Not only did its 6.2L V8 supercharged engine produce 638.1 BHP, but it also weighed just 1,508 kg and was able to beat the Nissan GT-R's time on the Nürburgring.

cars.name: Chris Holstrom Concepts CHC 1967 Chevy Nova
description: A custom hot rod that appeared at SEMA 2013. The 1967 Chevrolet Nova body has been outfitted with the 6.2L supercharged LS9 engine from the Corvette along with a number of racing grade parts throughout the brakes and suspension. It won the 'GT Award' that year.
cars.descriptionText: A custom hot rod that appeared at SEMA 2013. The 1967 Chevrolet Nova body has been outfitted with the 6.2L supercharged LS9 engine from the Corvette along with a number of racing grade parts throughout the brakes and suspension. It won the 'GT Award' that year.

cars.name: Citroën BX 19 TRS '87
description: The BX debuted at the 1982 Paris Salon. It carries the image of Citroën's historic GS and CX models while presenting a modern geometric design. It was designed by Marcello Gandini while he was working for Bertone. The suspension uses Citroën's classic hydropneumatic system. The 19 TRS model featured here is a grand tourer style model featuring a 1.9L petrol engine.

cars.name: Citroën DS 21 Pallas '70
description: The Citroën DS was unveiled at the 1955 Paris Salon as a revolutionary front-wheel drive car featuring an aerodynamic body and hydropneumatic suspension. It was dubbed the 'flying saucer'. Development was lead by André Lefèbvre, and the body designed by Flaminio Bertoni. In 1964, the 'Pallas' grade was introduced, and in 1967 came the quad headlights. The DS 21 Pallas offered elegant performance from its 2.1L engine and was produced for 20 years.

cars.name: Citroën GT by Citroën Gr.4
description: A racing car designed for competition in the Gr.4 category, it is a modified version of the 'GT by Citroën', which was unveiled at the 2008 Paris Motor Show. Modifications were performed by Takumi Yamamoto, who created the original design. The exterior features a 6-colour livery, as well as a large rear wing. In the meantime, the interior received modifications to the steering wheel and HUD.

cars.name: Citroën GT by Citroën Race Car (Gr.3)
description: A Gran Turismo Original model, this is a Gr.3 regulation version of the 'GT by Citroën', itself born from a collaboration between Gran Turismo and Citroën. Different from the stock model, the aggressive exterior, which evokes images of fighting robots, should leave a lasting impression on anyone who sees it. It also has excellent aerodynamics with a number of winglets across the body, providing a powerful downforce.

cars.name: Citroën GT by Citroën Road Car
description: Based on the 'GT by Citroën' displayed at the 2008 Paris Motor Show, this model has been developed to be the best road car it can be. The biggest rework in this model was the powertrain, changing it from a high-performance EV to a V8-powered, mid-engine sports car. The unusual armour-like styling was retained, resulting in an attractively unique, high-performance vehicle.

cars.name: Daihatsu Copen '02
description: First introduced as the 'Kopen' at the 1999 Tokyo Motor Show, this car became Daihatsu's first fully convertible 'kei' class car when it was released in 2002 as the 'Copen.' Thanks to its rigid yet lightweight body and specially tuned suspension, the car boasts impressive handling characteristics. The car also gained a lot of attention for being the first 'kei' class car in the world to feature a powered retractable top, and would be exported to countries like the UK and Australia.
cars.descriptionText: First introduced as the 'Kopen' at the 1999 Tokyo Motor Show, this car became Daihatsu's first fully convertible 'kei' class car when it was released in 2002 as the 'Copen.' Thanks to its rigid yet lightweight body and specially tuned suspension, the car boasts impressive handling characteristics. The car also gained a lot of attention for being the first 'kei' class car in the world to feature a powered retractable top, and would be exported to countries like the UK and Australia.

cars.name: Daihatsu COPEN RJ VGT
description: The Daihatsu Copen is a convertible that offers the full sports car experience while conforming to 'kei' car standards. The Copen RJ Vision Gran Turismo is based on the 2nd generation model, itself released in 2014. While retaining the 'kei' regulation 660 cc engine size, boost efficiency has been improved allowing it to achieve 146.9 BHP/20.6 kgfm. The car has also been further lightened to 600 kg allowing it to compete on the level of larger displacement sports cars. This aspirational work carries on Daihatsu's fighting spirit.

cars.name: De Tomaso Mangusta '69
description: De Tomaso's second production midship sports car. To remedy the lack of power in the previous Vallelunga, this car is equipped with a Ford V8 engine. Thanks to its light weight at roughly 1.3 tons, the car is able to reach a top speed of 155.3 mph. The exterior which features a gullwing opening rear section was designed by Giorgetto Giugiaro in his Carrozzeria Ghia era. Just 401 of these cars were produced.

cars.name: De Tomaso Pantera '71
description: The third model by De Tomaso. The Italian style body produced by Carrozzeria Ghia has been fitted with a Ford 5.8L V8 OHV engine. This lavish combination, while less expensive compared to its contemporary rivals, is able to meet them all on performance.
cars.descriptionText: The third model by De Tomaso. The Italian style body produced by Carrozzeria Ghia has been fitted with a Ford 5.8L V8 OHV engine. This lavish combination, while less expensive compared to its contemporary rivals, is able to meet them all on performance.

cars.name: DMC DeLorean S2 '04
description: Formerly vice president at GM, John Z. DeLorean went independent founding DMC. Their first production model was the DMC-12, which used a bold, stainless-steel body. Its gullwing doors were another point of note, yet despite such efforts, company would still go bankrupt in 1983. The owner of the new-born DMC, which would now service DeLoreans, answered demands from fans, later releasing the Series 2 DeLorean, which was equipped with an engine tuned to 197.2 BHP.

cars.name: Dodge Challenger R/T '70
description: This Dodge sports coupé was introduced in 1970 and featured the same E-body chassis as the Plymouth Barracuda. Aimed at the pony car market which was popular with the younger drivers at the time, it was sold as both a hard top and a convertible. The 'R/T' (Road/Track) was the Challenger's high-performance model, set above both the '6' and the 'V8.'

cars.name: Dodge Challenger SRT Demon '18
description: The 3rd generation Dodge Challenger was introduced in 2008 to carry on the legacy of the original Challenger, itself a masterpiece muscle car. A number of high performance models were released since its debut, but the star of the lineup came in 2018. This was the SRT Demon, a monster machine created for the sole purpose of winning drag races. Tuned to produce 840.2 BHP on 100 octane or higher fuel, it can run the quarter mile in a staggering 9.65s.

cars.name: Dodge Charger R/T 426 Hemi '68
description: Introduced in 1966, the Dodge Charger was Chrysler's answer to the muscle car boom that swept the United States in the 1960s. The car proved popular for its relaxed stylings and its use of powerful large displacement V8 engines across all model grades. The 1968 model saw the introduction of the high performance 'R/T' (Road/Track), which featured upgraded suspension and brakes along with the option for a 426 Hemi engine.
cars.descriptionText: Introduced in 1966, the Dodge Charger was Chrysler's answer to the muscle car boom that swept the United States in the 1960s. The car proved popular for its relaxed stylings and its use of powerful large displacement V8 engines across all model grades. The 1968 model saw the introduction of the high performance 'R/T' (Road/Track), which featured upgraded suspension and brakes along with the option for a 426 Hemi engine.

cars.name: Dodge Charger SRT Hellcat '15
description: This car offers the most extreme performance of all the models of the 3rd generation Charger, which originally debuted in 2005. Developed by Chrysler's high performance development team SRT, the Hellcat adds a supercharger to the 6.2L V8 Hemi engine to produce an astronomical 707.1 BHP/81 kgfm. Able to go from 0-60mph in 3.7 seconds and with a top speed of 203.8 mph, this was, for a time, the fastest 4-door sedan in the world.

cars.name: Dodge Charger SRT Hellcat Safety Car
description: Introduced in 2014, the Charger SRT Hellcat is perhaps the most powerful model in the history of the Dodge Charger, which has continued since 1966. Developed by SRT, Chrysler's high-performance development team, the car produces 707.1 BHP with a top speed of 204 mph. This safety car version is a Gran Turismo Original model.

cars.name: Dodge SRT Tomahawk GTS-R VGT
description: This is a car of the future combining uncompromising, unrestricted performance with awe-inspiring design. A mid-engine, four-wheel drive single seater, its body is made from cutting edge composite materials. The engine is a 1,000 horsepower 6.98L V10 supported by a pneumatic sub unit. The GTS-R is the racing version of the Tomahawk. A special racing suit is also provided to help the driver withstand the immense G-forces possible in this vehicle.

A mid-engine, four-wheel drive single seater, its body is made from cutting edge composite materials. The engine is a 1,000 horsepower 6.98L V10 supported by a pneumatic sub unit. The GTS-R is the racing version of the Tomahawk. A special racing suit is also provided to help the driver withstand the immense G-forces possible in this vehicle.

cars.name: Dodge SRT Tomahawk S VGT
description: This is a car of the future combining uncompromising, unrestricted performance with awe-inspiring design. A mid-engine, four-wheel drive single seater, its body is made from cutting edge composite materials. The engine is a 1,000 horsepower 6.98L V10 supported by a pneumatic sub unit. The 'S' is a more realistic version of the Tomahawk, with considerations for open road driving. However, using the car to its full potential will require near superhuman reflexes.

cars.name: Dodge SRT Tomahawk VGT (Gr.1)
description: A Gran Turismo original model, this is a Gr.1 regulation version of the Dodge SRT Tomahawk Vision Gran Turismo that was created in a collaboration between Gran Turismo and Dodge. The car features new aerodynamic parts to make sure the car's over 700 horsepower is fully transferred to the ground. These include an extended front splitter and rear wing created by Dodge Design as well as 4 canards.

cars.name: Dodge SRT Tomahawk X VGT
description: This is a car of the future combining uncompromising, unrestricted performance with awe-inspiring design. A mid-engine, four-wheel drive single seater, its body is made from cutting edge composite materials. The engine is a 1,000 horsepower 6.98L V10 supported by a pneumatic sub unit. The 'X' is an extreme model reserved only for those who are deemed fit to drive it, as it increases the total system output to 2,465.5 BHP.

cars.name: Dodge Super Bee '70
description: The Dodge Super Bee is a performance oriented yet cost effective muscle car unveiled in 1968. The line-up featured 3 different high-powered engines with the 425 BHP 7.0L engine sitting on top as the most powerful. The car was relatively spartan with few comfort items. A facelift model was released in 1970, before being replaced in 1971 with a 2nd generation model based on the Charger.

cars.name: Dodge Viper Gr.4
description: This Gran Turismo Original modifies the Viper, Dodge's high-performance sports car, to meet Gr.4 regulations. The exterior features an aggressive front splitter and canards, along with a large rear wing to produce an immense downforce. The result is a car that is great in the straights and has much potential for the corners as well.

cars.name: Dodge Viper GTS '02
description: A coupé model developed to harness the full potential of the Viper. The basic construction, suspension and the V10 engine remained unchanged from the roadster RT/10, though power output was increased to 449.7 BHP. Thanks to the new fixed roof however, the car was able to achieve a top speed of 185mph (roughly 183.9 mph) as opposed to the roadster's 165mph. The GTS-R version which debuted at the same time appeared at endurance races all around the world, proving its superior performance.

cars.name: Dodge Viper GTS '13
description: The 3rd generation Viper debuted in 2012. The main point of interest for the new model was that it would be released by SRT, Chrysler's high performance brand. While the displacement of the V10 engine remained unchanged at 8.4L, numerous improvements were made to the internals allowing it to produce 640 BHP/83 kgfm. Like previous models, the chassis uses a steel tube frame, though rigidity has been increased by 50%. The highest grade model, the GTS, also includes active suspension.

While the displacement of the V10 engine remained unchanged at 8.4L, numerous improvements were made to the internals allowing it to produce 640 BHP/83 kgfm. Like previous models, the chassis uses a steel tube frame, though rigidity has been increased by 50%. The highest grade model, the GTS, also includes active suspension.

cars.name: Dodge Viper SRT GT3-R '15
description: At the debut of the 3rd generation Viper in 2012, it was also announced that there would be a racing model, the GTS-R. The GT3-R is a GT3 machine made for private teams, based on the GTS-R. Developed by SRT (Chrysler's high performance development team) and Riley Technologies, the weight of the car has been drastically reduced, and aerodynamic enhancements have been added. The car has already proved its racing potential in numerous GT races in America and other parts of the world.

cars.name: Dodge Viper SRT10 Coupe '06
description: This coupé model was introduced in the Viper's second generation which had evolved as a sports car. It also features the 'SRT' badge found on many of Chrysler's high performance models. A lightweight body with a 509.9 BHP 8.3L V10 engine means this car has the potential to race alongside its international rivals.

cars.name: DS AUTOMOBILES DS 3 Racing '11
description: A premium compact announced in 2009. Though it uses the same platform as the C3, the car carries the DS brand and features unique stylings, as well as a high standard of quality. The DS 3 Racing is a special model sold to celebrate its entry in the WRC, starting 2011. Developed by Citroën Racing, the engine has received a considerable increase in power, as well as modifications to the chassis.

cars.name: Eckert's Rod & Custom Mach Forty
description: A monster Mustang crafted by one of Oregon's most respected shops. Everything from the rear seats through to the boot has been taken out to make room for a midship mounted 5.4L V8 supercharged engine from a Ford GT, able to produce up to 850.1 BHP. The car was displayed at SEMA 2012 where it won the GT Award.

cars.name: Ferrari 250 GT Berlinetta passo corto '61
description: The 250 GT Berlinetta was given a shorter wheelbase than its predecessor to increase cornering performance on track. These efforts paid off and from 1960 the car would claim countless victories in races like the Tour de France and the Nürburgring 621.4 miles. 162 cars were produced until 1962 when it was replaced by the 250 GTO, itself based on this car.

cars.name: Ferrari 250 GTO '62
description: Until the early 1960s, there was only a vague distinction between racing cars and road cars; and this car is an icon of that era. The 'GTO' of its name indicates it is a GT homologation model. The framework is tubular steel, while its bodywork was made of aluminium. The 3L V12 engine employed 6 carburettors to produce 295.9 BHP. The right-hand drive model produced for the UK market reached the podium on numerous occasions at races throughout the UK.

cars.name: Ferrari 296 GT3 '23
description: A GT3 machine developed from the 296 GTB, the 296 GT3 has removed the plug-in hybrid system from the road car to become a purebred racing car using only the 600-horsepower V6 twin-turbo engine. The car is produced by world-class racing constructor Oreca, which handles everything from chassis construction to assembly to customer service. After its unveiling at the 24 Hours of Spa in July 2022, it showcased its high-performance racing ability by recording 100 race victories in under two years.

cars.name: Ferrari 296 GTB '22
description: The 296 GTB is a plug-in hybrid that also features the first V6 engine since the Dino series. The smallest model in the current Ferrari lineup, its classically designed body is an homage to the classic 250 LM of the 1960s. It seats a 3L V6 twin-turbo engine in the midship position, which combined with the 123 kW electric motor produces a total system output of 830 horsepower. Able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in just 2.9s and reach a top speed of 205.1 mph this car boasts performance worthy of the Ferrari name.

The smallest model in the current Ferrari lineup, its classically designed body is an homage to the classic 250 LM of the 1960s. It seats a 3L V6 twin-turbo engine in the midship position, which combined with the 123 kW electric motor produces a total system output of 830 horsepower. Able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in just 2.9s and reach a top speed of 205.1 mph this car boasts performance worthy of the Ferrari name.

cars.name: Ferrari 308 GTB '75
description: Debuting in 1975, the 308 GTB served as the replacement for the Dino 246 GT and started a long-running trend of 2-seater V8 models. The elegant bodywork, which sits upon the steel, tube-based frame was designed by the same man who would go on to design numerous other Ferraris throughout the late 1960s to the early 1990s, Leonardo Fioravanti, who worked for Pininfarina at the time.
cars.descriptionText: Debuting in 1975, the 308 GTB served as the replacement for the Dino 246 GT and started a long-running trend of 2-seater V8 models. The elegant bodywork, which sits upon the steel, tube-based frame was designed by the same man who would go on to design numerous other Ferraris throughout the late 1960s to the early 1990s, Leonardo Fioravanti, who worked for Pininfarina at the time.

cars.name: Ferrari 330 P4 '67
description: The 330 P4 was developed to defeat the up-and-coming Ford GT. While only 4 were produced in total, there was a berlinetta variant for high-speed circuits and a spider variant which had removed the roof to reduce weight. It won its debut race at the 24 Hours of Daytona. While Ford managed to take victory at Le Mans, Ferrari would go on to win the World Sportscar Championship title.

cars.name: Ferrari 365 GTB4 '71
description: The last Ferrari to use a front-mounted 12-cylinder engine, the 365 GTB/4, aka 'Daytona', made its debut at the 1968 Paris Motor Show. The sleek bodywork designed by Leonardo Fioravanti hides a 4,390 cc V12 DOHC engine. Capable of a top speed of 174 mph, it matched its rival, the Lamborghini Miura, as the fastest car of its time.

cars.name: Ferrari 430 Scuderia '07
description: Introduced in September 2007 at the Frankfurt Motor Show, the 430 Scuderia is a culmination of Ferrari's F1 experience and the fastest V8 Berlinetta they've ever produced. Compared to the base F430, the engine has been further tuned, weight has been reduced, and the aero surfaces have been modified. The cumulative result is the car is now able to reach a blistering top speed of 198.8 mph and accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in just 3.6s.
cars.descriptionText: Introduced in September 2007 at the Frankfurt Motor Show, the 430 Scuderia is a culmination of Ferrari's F1 experience and the fastest V8 Berlinetta they've ever produced. Compared to the base F430, the engine has been further tuned, weight has been reduced, and the aero surfaces have been modified. The cumulative result is the car is now able to reach a blistering top speed of 198.8 mph and accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in just 3.6s.

cars.name: Ferrari 458 Italia '09
description: Introduced at the 2009 Frankfurt Motor Show, this model is the successor to the F430. The chassis uses an all-new aluminium space-frame and is equipped with a 4,499 cc V8 engine producing 562.1 BHP/55.1 kgfm. The 'Manettino' system which unifies systems like the engine, transmission and suspension, has also been greatly improved. Using aerodynamics technology taken from their F1 machines, the car can achieve 0-62.1 mph in 3.4 seconds and has a top speed of 201.9 mph.

cars.name: Ferrari 458 Italia Gr.4
description: A Gran Turismo Original, this is a Gr.4 version of the 458 Italia an entry-level model in Ferrari's line-up. The base model already produces ample downforce so while there are relatively few aero parts visible, the car is extremely stable. Along with the flexible Ferrari V8 and 7-speed transmission, this car has excellent potential on the circuit.

cars.name: Ferrari 458 Italia GT3 '13
description: The 458 Italia GT3 is a GT3 regulation race car developed from the 458 Italia. The front bumper is set lower acting as an air dam, and a large rear wing has also been added. While it shares the same power unit as the road model, a restrictor has been fitted limiting the power to 542.4 BHP. Debuting in 2011, it would take the FIA-GT3 European championship title the same year.

cars.name: Ferrari 500 Mondial Pinin Farina Coupe '54
description: With a chassis and engine by Ferrari and a body by Pininfarina, the 500 Mondial Pinin Farina Coupe was created for competition in the 1954 Tour de France. While it was unable to compete in the Tour de France as planned, an unrestored original example of this car still exists and won the 'Gran Turismo Award' at the 2012 Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.
cars.descriptionText: With a chassis and engine by Ferrari and a body by Pininfarina, the 500 Mondial Pinin Farina Coupe was created for competition in the 1954 Tour de France. cars.name: Ferrari 512 BB '76
description: A modified version of the 365 GT4/BB, Ferrari's 12-cylinder road car and their first to use a mid-engine layout. The main point of interest for this upgrade is the enlargement of the 12-cylinder engine to 5L, though changes to comply with exhaust gas regulations means the car produces 19.7 BHP less for a total of 355 BHP. Torque though has increased by 4 kgfm to 46 kgfm. One of Ferrari's most unforgettable classics, this car, along with Lamborghini's Countach would become the symbol of 1970s Italian supercars.

cars.name: Ferrari 812 Superfast '17
description: The 812 Superfast was introduced in 2017 to continue Ferrari's lineage of front-engined V12 models. This car is Ferrari's first to use electric-power steering and has inherited an improved version of the 4-wheel steering system from the F12berlinetta, which means that despite its relatively long 2,720 mm wheelbase, the car is still capable of tight turns.

cars.name: Ferrari Dino 246 GT '71
description: An evolution of the Dino 206 GT introduced in 1968, named after the late son of Enzo Ferrari. The aluminium body has been replaced with a steel construction, and the wheelbase has been lengthened to improve control stability. The cast-iron block engine has been enlarged to 2.4L reaching 192.3 BHP/23 kgfm.

cars.name: Ferrari Enzo Ferrari '02
description: This supersports car with a limited production of 399 cars was released in 2002 to celebrate the 55th anniversary of Ferrari. Its sharp-nosed body reminiscent of F1 machines was designed by Ken (Kiyoyuki) Okuyama, a designer at Pininfarina at the time. The body panels and most of the framework is made of carbon composites. The engine is a specially developed 6L V12 producing 650.9 BHP/67 kgfm allowing for a top speed of over 217.5 mph.

cars.name: Ferrari F12berlinetta '12
description: The F12berlinetta is a flagship model from Ferrari introduced in 2012 to replace the 599 GTB Fiorano. It features a new aluminium space frame and body shell equipped with a front-midship mounted V12 engine. Performance increases from the optimized body layout allow for a 0-62.1 mph time of 3.1s and a top speed of 211.3 mph. It would set the lap record at the Fiorano test track.
cars.descriptionText: The F12berlinetta is a flagship model from Ferrari introduced in 2012 to replace the 599 GTB Fiorano. It features a new aluminium space frame and body shell equipped with a front-midship mounted V12 engine. Performance increases from the optimized body layout allow for a 0-62.1 mph time of 3.1s and a top speed of 211.3 mph. It would set the lap record at the Fiorano test track.

cars.name: Ferrari F40 '92
description: A special model commemorating the 40th anniversary of the founding of Ferrari. Developed with the same methods as racing cars of the time, the car used a steel pipe frame with composite materials such as carbon-Kevlar and aluminium honeycomb structures. The power unit was based on the same V8 twin-turbo as the 288 GTO, producing 478.3 BHP/58 kgfm. It would be the last road car that Enzo Ferrari would work on, and retains a high level of popularity even to this day.

cars.name: Ferrari F430 '06
description: The Ferrari F430 is a midship V8 supercar which debuted in 2004. The newly developed 4.3L engine produces 483.2 BHP. The chassis has been developed from the 360 Modena with improvements in stability and downforce, and uses Extra Super Duralumin aluminium alloy. This top grade sports car has a top speed of 195.7 mph and is available with carbon ceramic brakes.

cars.name: Ferrari F50 '95
description: A special model commemorating the 50th anniversary of the founding of Ferrari. Developed under the concept of a 'road-going F1 car', the engine is a version of the V12 engine from the 1990 '641' F1 car enlarged to 4.7L and mounted directly to the chassis. Now producing 512.8 BHP/48 kgfm, the car is able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in 3.87s, eventually reaching a top speed of 201.9 mph.

cars.name: Ferrari F8 Tributo '19
description: The Ferrari F8 Tributo was unveiled in 2019 as the successor to the 488 GTB. While externally similar to the 488, major changes have been made to aerodynamic details changing its overall image. The 3.9L V8 twin-turbo engine produces 710.1 BHP allowing for a 0-62.1 mph time of 2.9s and a top speed of 211.3 mph making it the fastest ever V8 model. Thanks to latest in body control devices, this car is also exceptionally easy to drive.
