cars.name: Ferrari Ferrari VGT
description: The Ferrari Vision Gran Turismo is Ferrari's first ever virtual-only single seater concept and features design inspirations from sports prototype cars of the 1960s and 70s. The 3L turbo charged V6 hybrid engine combined with the 3 electric motors produced a total system output of 1,015.8 BHP. The design carries on the DNA of past classics while giving a powerful hint of the future of endurance racing.

cars.name: Ferrari FXX K '14
description: The FXX K is a track-only model developed from the LaFerrari and produced in a run of just 32 cars in 2014. It combines the 6.3L V12 engine from the LaFerrari with a 187.4 BHP electric motor for a total system output of 1,035.5 BHP. Aerodynamics have also been improved, and with the EVO kit installed, it produces 75% extra downforce. Untethered to any racing regulations, this car is able to provide the ultimate in driving performance.

cars.name: Ferrari GTO '84
description: This homologation model was produced in a run of 200 units to meet Group B regulations. Externally similar to the 308, the wheelbase has actually been increased by 110 mm and the engine converted to a longitudinal mounting, meaning the internals are all different. The 2.8L twin-turbo engine produces 394.5 BHP making it the fastest Ferrari at the time.

cars.name: Ferrari LaFerrari '13
description: One of Ferrari's special models, the history of which includes the F40, F50 and Enzo Ferrari. Made with the same materials and methods as Ferrari's F1 cars, it features a carbon monocoque shell equipped with a version of the F12berlinetta's 6.3L V12 engine tuned to 788 BHP, and also utilises the HY-KERS hybrid system. The car boasts a 0-62.1 mph time of under 3 seconds, a 0-124.3 mph time of under 7 seconds and an incredible top speed of 217.5 mph.

cars.name: Ferrari Testarossa '91
description: Unveiled in 1984, the Testarossa was Ferrari's flagship midship layout model. The engine is a 5L 180 degree V12 unit producing a maximum 384.6 BHP power and 50.0 kgfm torque. It can accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in 5.8s, eventually reaching a top speed of 180.2 mph. The car's artistically elegant body, marked by its iconic 5-fin strakes and the rear fenders sharply jutting out from the compact cabin, have garnered a whole new generation of fans.

cars.name: FIAT 500 1.2 8V Lounge SS '08
description: Thanks to its economical price and charming looks, the FIAT 500 was able sell 4 million units across 20 years from its release in 1957. 50 years after the release of the 2nd gen model came the 3rd generation FIAT 500. Debuting at the 2004 Geneva Show, it would eventually release to massive popularity in summer 2007. The car is lovingly known by fans all over the world as the 'Cinquecento,' the Italian for '500.'

cars.name: FIAT 500 F '68
description: A car that represents the realisation of the FIAT company's goal of making cars for the mass market. Born in 1957, its extremely compact body mounts a 14.8 BHP 497 cc engine in the rear. While small, the car was very practical, and with its low price tag it gained huge popularity, even garnering numerous tuned models from Abarth. The F model featured front-hinged doors for the first time.

cars.name: FIAT Panda 30 CL '85
description: The FIAT Panda is a front-wheel drive hatchback that debuted in 1980 during the compact car boom that followed the oil crises. Its packaging was designed by virtuoso Giorgetto Giugiaro. In order to reduce costs, the body is constructed with straight lines and flat panels, giving it a simple yet modern and practical appearance. When it was first released, the car was available with either an air-cooled 652 cc 2-cylinder engine or a water cooled 903 cc 4-cylinder engine. This model featured in Gran Turismo is the former.

cars.name: Ford Escort RS Cosworth '92
description: Introduced in 1992, the Escort RS Cosworth is a homologation model supporting Ford's efforts in the WRC. Inheriting the 2L twin-cam engine (223.9 BHP) from the Sierra and equipped with a four-wheel drive system, it was capable of incredible performance in rallying. It achieved a 1-2 in the Rally de Portugal and consecutive wins in the Tour de Corse and Acropolis Rally, reinstating Ford's status as a rallying powerhouse.

cars.name: Ford F-150 SVT Raptor '11
description: The F-Series is a line of full size pickup trucks sold by Ford since 1948. This popular model has been the number one selling car in the United States for over 30 years. The F-150 SVT Raptor, developed by Ford's special vehicle development team 'SVT', is a special off-road model based on the same four-wheel drive system, designed for desert racing.

cars.name: Ford Focus Gr.B Rally Car
description: A Gran Turismo Original, Ford's Focus global hatchback has been modified to meet Gr.B regulations. Air intakes have been added ahead of the rear fenders to send air to the rear mounted radiator. Moving the radiator to the boot has improved the weight distribution and resulted in one of the easiest cars to drive of the Gr.B category.

cars.name: Ford Focus RS '18
description: Introduced in 2018, the 4th generation Ford Focus featured a high performance 'RS' model in the line-up. This 4th gen RS model was the first to feature four-wheel drive and had adjustable torque distribution. It also features new selectable drive modes like 'Track' and 'Drift' alongside improvements to the chassis and dampers. The engine is a 2.3L inline-4 'EcoBoost' unit producing 345.2 BHP. This car boasts excellent performance with a 0-62.1 mph time of 4.7s and a top speed of 165.3 mph.

cars.name: Ford Focus ST '15
description: The Focus ST, the sports model of the Focus line, has been a popular choice since its debut in 1998. The ST stands for 'Sports Technology.' While the 3rd generation ST features a smaller engine than the previous model, the power has been increased by 24.7 BHP for a total of 246.5 BHP. This model caters for the hardcore enthusiast with such features as the full six-speed manual transmission, in a market where many have moved over to 2 pedal systems.

cars.name: Ford Ford GT '06
description: The Ford GT which celebrates the company's 100th anniversary takes its silhouette and spirit from the GT40, which achieved legendary status after dominating the top 3 places of the 1966 Le Mans 24 Hour race and winning consecutively for 4 years until 1969. The car boasts a 0-60mph time of 3.3 seconds and a top speed of 205.1 mph. 4038 cars were produced over 3 years until 2006.

cars.name: Ford Ford GT '17
description: From 2005 to 2006, Ford produced the Ford GT, a remake of the GT40, but in 2015 they would announce a 2nd generation model. This 2nd gen model, while retaining the flow of the GT40, adopted an extensively aerodynamic design. It uses a carbon fibre cell with aluminium subframes to reduce weight and is capable of a top speed of 216.2 mph.

cars.model: Ford GT LM Race Car Spec II
cars.name: Ford Ford GT LM Race Car Spec II
description: This LM race car is a Le Mans spec style reimagining of the Ford GT, itself a reinterpretation of the 1960s classic GT40 using modern technology. Carrying on from the GT40's historic bid for victory at the 24 Hours of Le Mans, this car features a 5.4L supercharged V8 DOHC engine producing 591.7 BHP. It is also equipped with double wishbone suspension and a racing style 6-speed gearbox.

Carrying on from the GT40's historic bid for victory at the 24 Hours of Le Mans, this car features a 5.4L supercharged V8 DOHC engine producing 591.7 BHP. It is also equipped with double wishbone suspension and a racing style 6-speed gearbox.

cars.model: Ford GT LM Spec II Test Car
cars.name: Ford Ford GT LM Spec II Test Car
description: This LM spec race car took the Ford GT, released in summer 2004, and rebuilt it to race at Le Mans. The power output was increased from the 550.3 BHP of the street model, to 591.7 BHP and the body, while keeping the size and shape of the Ford GT, was reproduced in all carbon fibre for a kerb weight of just 1,150 kg.

The power output was increased from the 550.3 BHP of the street model, to 591.7 BHP and the body, while keeping the size and shape of the Ford GT, was reproduced in all carbon fibre for a kerb weight of just 1,150 kg.

cars.name: Ford Ford GT Race Car '18
description: Released in 2015, the second generation Ford GT reimagining focuses on aerodynamics and speed with its compact V6 twin-turbo engine capable of a 0-62.1 mph time of 3.0s and a top speed of 216.2 mph. In racing, Chip Ganassi Racing of the United States competed in the FIA World Endurance Championship and the IMSA from 2016.

cars.name: Ford Ford Roadster
description: The roots of this car lie in the custom car and hot rod culture of the United States that dates back to the 1930s. Model T and Model B Fords would commonly be given bold exterior modifications and have their engines swapped for more powerful units. The engine of the 'V-3883' displayed in the Henry Ford Museum has been swapped for a 177.5 BHP Chrysler 331 Hemi. This car is relatively simple yet beautiful example, with the engine cover itself serving as an exterior accent.

Model T and Model B Fords would commonly be given bold exterior modifications and have their engines swapped for more powerful units. The engine of the 'V-3883' displayed in the Henry Ford Museum has been swapped for a 177.5 BHP Chrysler 331 Hemi. This car is relatively simple yet beautiful example, with the engine cover itself serving as an exterior accent.

cars.name: Ford GT40 Mark I '66
description: In an attempt to make a mark on the racing world, Ford collaborated with Lola Cars to create the Mark I. Completed in 1964, the car was based on the Lola-designed 'Mk6' and was unveiled as the Ford GT. The GT40 name was coined by a reporter who was astounded by its height, at a mere 40 inches from the ground. At the 1966 24 Hours of Le Mans, the improved model, the Mark II, achieved a miraculous 1-2-3 finish.
cars.descriptionText: In an attempt to make a mark on the racing world, Ford collaborated with Lola Cars to create the Mark I. Completed in 1964, the car was based on the Lola-designed 'Mk6' and was unveiled as the Ford GT. At the 1966 24 Hours of Le Mans, the improved model, the Mark II, achieved a miraculous 1-2-3 finish.

cars.name: Ford Mark IV Race Car '67
description: After dominating the 1966 24 Hours of Le Mans, Ford developed a new test car to meet the changes in FIA vehicle regulations, creating the Mark IV. With its superbly aerodynamic body, the car's top speed increased to 215.6 mph, while also gaining high-speed stability which helped it win the 1967 review race. The car went on to beat its rival by a full 5 laps, taking victory at the 24 Hours of Le Mans.

cars.name: Ford Mustang Boss 429 '69
description: This high performance model was only available on the 1969 and 1970 models of Ford's original Mustang. Produced for NASCAR homologation, it featured the largest engine displacement in a Mustang with a 7L V8 429 unit. Easily recognisable by the large bonnet scoop, it is often called the most powerful Mustang in history.

cars.name: Ford Mustang Gr.3
description: The Mustang Gr.3 is a Gran Turismo Original model which takes Ford's legendary Mustang coupé and modifies it to meet Gr.3 regulations. The fenders have been stretched out to fit wider tyres and large air outlets have been added to the rear to effectively route air outwards. This muscle car finds its strengths in the stability of its long wheelbase and its unbeatable top speed.

cars.name: Ford Mustang Gr.3 Road Car
description: This is a homologation model of the Mustang Gr.3, a Gran Turismo Original model that modified Ford's legendary Mustang coupé to meet Gr.3 regulations. As this model is based on a race car, the performance characteristics have been improved with a focus on cornering. This all-rounder is equally at home taking on time attacks at the circuit or drifting.

cars.name: Ford Mustang Gr.4
description: The Mustang Gr.4 is a Gran Turismo Original model which takes Ford's legendary Mustang coupé and modifies it to meet Gr.4 regulations. Thanks to the high stability of the original, this touring car is an excellent choice for beginners. The exterior also stands out for its use of the classic Ford racing stripe.

cars.name: Ford Mustang Gr.B Rally Car
description: The Mustang Gr.B is a Gran Turismo Original model which takes Ford's legendary Mustang coupé and modifies it to meet Gr.B regulations. The livery is based on the Ford GT works livery. Ford has a deep history in rallying having produced cars like the Escort and RS200, so this seemingly mismatched custom actually fits the bill quite well.

cars.name: Ford Mustang GT '15
description: In 2014, the 50th anniversary of its debut and with its market larger than ever, the 6th generation Ford Mustang was released after an intensive development cycle by Ford. The car featured more aggressive styling and new four-wheel independent suspension. While there are many models in the line-up, the Mustang GT is the one for fans of the series, featuring the signature V8 engine.

cars.name: Ford Mustang Mach 1 '71
description: After its hit debut in 1964, the original Ford Mustang received a major facelift in 1969, with a new, larger body design. The Mach 1 model which featured the 'SportsRoof' fastback body, was especially popular among the line-up for its aggressive look. Its design had a significant impact on sports car styling all around the world.

cars.name: Ford Shelby GT350R '16
description: The original GT350R was developed for race competition in 1965, based on the original Mustang. The 2016 Shelby GT350R was similarly based on the seventh generation Mustang, with the engine tuned to 525.6 BHP. The chassis components supporting the engine performance were also upgraded, resulting in a car that was fit to go to the circuit straight from the factory.

cars.name: Ford Sierra RS 500 Cosworth '87
description: The Sierra RS Cosworth was created in 1995 by the masters at Cosworth. Originally a family car, the Sierra’s 2L inline-4 engine was fully tuned, adding a DOHC head and turbocharger, along with other chassis upgrades. The Sierra RS500 Cosworth was introduced a year later. Between 1988 and 1990, it competed in Group A category races around the world, winning several championship titles.

cars.name: Garage RCR Garage RCR Civic
description: Winner of the 2017 'Gran Turismo Award'. The base 1992 EG model Civic has been fitted with a PANDEM wide body kit and carbon fibre bonnet based on a design by J's Racing. The interior has been stripped out, and the engine has been swapped for a K24 inline-4 unit. This car is a shining example of the JDM (Japanese Domestic Market) scene.

cars.name: Genesis G70 3.3T AWD P.Package '22
description: Genesis' G70 sports sedan was introduced in 2017 as the brand's entry model. 3 power unit options were available, a 3.3L V6 twin-turbo, a 2L petrol turbo and a 2.2L turbodiesel, with the V6 producing 364.9 BHP. A major facelift was released in 2020, adopting design features from the luxury models. The car also gained attention when a shooting brake model was released exclusively for Europe in 2021.

cars.name: Genesis G70 GR4
description: As an entry model, the G70 is tasked with introducing drivers to the appeal of the Genesis brand. The design was updated in 2020, adopting the aesthetics of the higher grade models, and in 2021 a shooting brake was introduced exclusively for Europe. This Genesis G70 GR4 is a Gran Turismo version tuned for Gr.4 competition.

cars.name: Genesis Genesis X GR3
description: In April 2021, Genesis unveiled their vision for new future GT cars, the Genesis X Concept. It uses the company's 'Athletic Elegance' design language, featuring the crest grille and straight body lines. The Genesis X GR3 is a racing machine that inherits the essence of this design. This innovative Gr.3 machine realises the merging of luxury and competition prowess.

This innovative Gr.3 machine realises the merging of luxury and competition prowess.

cars.model: Genesis X Gran Berlinetta VGT Concept
cars.name: Genesis Genesis X Gran Berlinetta VGT Concept
description: The Genesis X Gran Berlinetta Vision Gran Turismo Concept is the ultimate rendering of Genesis' 'Athletic Elegance.' The design uses Genesis' trademark anti-wedge shape and exhibits new ideas for Genesis sports models. The powertrain combines the Lambda II V6 engine with electric assists to produce 1,071 HP (1,071 BHP.) The result is a car that matches its beauty with its power.

cars.model: Genesis X Gran Racer VGT Concept
cars.name: Genesis Genesis X Gran Racer VGT Concept
description: The Genesis X Gran Racer Vision Gran Turismo Concept is the ultimate rendering of Genesis' 'Athletic Elegance.' The Racer version greatly increases downforce to improve lap times. The powertrain is a hybrid system with a V6 engine and electric assists, producing a total 1,518.7 BHP in power and 1,015ft-lb (140.3 kgfm) in torque.

cars.name: Gran Turismo F1500T-A
description: The Gran Turismo F1500T-A is a modern interpretation of a mid-80s F1 race car design, often called the golden age of F1 styling. The chassis made of carbon fibre is 4,235 mm long, 2,146 mm wide and has a wheelbase of 2,718 mm. The 1.5 litre V6 engine symbolic of 80s F1 racing, produces 986.2 BHP at 11,000rpm.

cars.name: Gran Turismo F3500-A
description: The F3500-A is a Gran Turismo original formula machine born from a deep admiration for early 1990s F1 cars. It features a carbon fibre chassis and pushrod suspension. The 3.5L naturally aspirated V12 engine is able to reach 15,000 rpm and is connected to a 6-speed semiautomatic transmission. Formula cars are constantly evolving. The F3500-A can be considered a benchmark to see how far they have come.
cars.descriptionText: The F3500-A is a Gran Turismo original formula machine born from a deep admiration for early 1990s F1 cars. It features a carbon fibre chassis and pushrod suspension. The 3.5L naturally aspirated V12 engine is able to reach 15,000 rpm and is connected to a 6-speed semiautomatic transmission. Formula cars are constantly evolving. The F3500-A can be considered a benchmark to see how far they have come.

cars.name: Gran Turismo F3500-B
description: The F3500-A was created as a love letter to early 1990s F1, and the F3500-B continues this lineage. The biggest change is the powertrain. While the F3500-A features a V12 engine, the F3500-B uses a compact lightweight V8. A V8 would usually produce less power, but this engine is able to reach up to 13,800 rpm, producing over 700.2 BHP as a result. The F3500-B also features 3 different front wings for the high-nose.

cars.name: Gran Turismo Racing Kart 125 Shifter
description: While racing karts are often seen as an entry point to motorsports, the Shifter Kart is what you might like to call a sub-formula car. With its 125 cc water-cooled 2-stroke engine connected to a 6-speed transmission and front only brakes, the kart can reach a top speed of 124.3 miles. This is a true racing machine that is used to train top drivers.

cars.name: Gran Turismo Red Bull X2014 Junior
description: The X2014 Series was born from a collaborative 'fan car' project between Red Bull Racing and Gran Turismo. The X2014 Junior entry-level model combines a compact body with a similarly compact engine producing roughly 246.5 BHP, to create the perfect machine on which to learn the basics of formula driving.

cars.name: Gran Turismo Red Bull X2014 Standard
description: The X2014 Series was born from a collaborative 'fan car' project between Red Bull Racing and Gran Turismo. The X2014 Standard, the mid-range model, was developed as a conventional Venturi car. The design reduces air resistance with front and back wheel covers and a glass canopy, and also produces more downforce.

cars.name: Gran Turismo Red Bull X2019 Competition
description: The X2019 Competition was created at the outset of the Gran Turismo Championship, aiming to create a race car that was as enjoyable to drive as it was to watch. It is based on the X2014 Standard, but the design aesthetics of the front wheel, rear body construction, and rear wheel covers have changed. Additionally, the engine has been changed from a 2L turbo to a 3L naturally aspirated unit, with the throttle also changed to a conventional system.

cars.name: GReddy GReddy Fugu Z
description: Winner of the 'GT Award' at SEMA 2015. Built by actor Sung Kang, this custom car is built from a 1973 Nissan 240Z. The engine is an RB26DETT unit from a GT-R converted to natural aspiration, producing 216 BHP. The over-fenders and front/rear spoilers are produced by Rocket Bunny.

The engine is an RB26DETT unit from a GT-R converted to natural aspiration, producing 216 BHP. The over-fenders and front/rear spoilers are produced by Rocket Bunny.

cars.name: Greening Auto Company GAC Maverick
description: This 2018 SEMA 'Best of Show' winning 1971 Ford Maverick was created by the Greening Auto Company. The ride height has been dropped as far as possible for an eye-catching look. The 7L Windsor V8 engine has been fitted with 2 turbochargers to produce 1,199.2 BHP, but some flexibility has also been added and the engine control logic can be changed for a leisurely cruise around town.

cars.name: Honda 2&4 powered by RC213V
description: The 'Honda Project 2&4 powered by RC213V' was born from a collaborative effort between Honda's design team and Gran Turismo. The design combines the 212 BHP Honda RC213V-S engine and an ultralight body weighing 405 kg to create a new kind of mobility with the openness and agility of a motorcycle and the handling and lateral G feeling of a 4-wheeled vehicle.

The design combines the 212 BHP Honda RC213V-S engine and an ultralight body weighing 405 kg to create a new kind of mobility with the openness and agility of a motorcycle and the handling and lateral G feeling of a 4-wheeled vehicle.

cars.name: Honda Beat '91
description: Introduced in 1991, the Honda Beat lead the lightweight 2-seater boom. At a superbly light 760 kg, the car also boasts an ideal 43:57 front:rear weight distribution. With its engine which uses F1 technology and its short-stroke transmission, the car offers a ride like nothing else. You don't have to go all the way out to winding roads to enjoy the Beat, you can fully appreciate the joy of this sports car on your daily drive.

cars.name: Honda Civic Si Extra (EF) '87
description: In 1987, the Honda Civic received a full model change, introducing the 4th generation. Known as the Grand Civic, the model code is EF. Its most notable feature is the platform change, which introduces double wishbone suspension on all 4 wheels. The 'Si' sport model and luxury 'Si Extra' model both use the 1.6L inline-4 DOHC 'ZC' engine. The Si and Si Extra also competed in the Japan Touring Car Championship, where they would claim title victories.

Its most notable feature is the platform change, which introduces double wishbone suspension on all 4 wheels. The 'Si' sport model and luxury 'Si Extra' model both use the 1.6L inline-4 DOHC 'ZC' engine. The Si and Si Extra also competed in the Japan Touring Car Championship, where they would claim title victories.

cars.name: Honda Civic SiR･II (EG) '93
description: The Civic is Honda's longest selling model. The 5th generation 'EG' Civic, introduced in September 1991, was marketed as the 'sports Civic.' The star of the sports Civic lineup was the SiR grade model that featured a 1.6L DOHC VTEC engine. Building upon the previous model SiR which had reached the 100HP per litre of displacement mark, this model produced 9.9 BHP more at 167.7 BHP.

Building upon the previous model SiR which had reached the 100HP per litre of displacement mark, this model produced 9.9 BHP more at 167.7 BHP.

cars.name: Honda Civic Type R (EK) '97
description: Starting with the debut of the original in 1972, the Civic is Honda's longest selling car. 1997 saw the introduction of the first Type R model, based on the 6th generation Civic. The 'B16B' 1.6L inline-4 DOHC engine is able to produce 182.4 BHP despite being naturally aspirated. As is the style of the Type R, modifications like body weight reduction and suspension upgrades have also been implemented. It proved to be immensely popular, seeing use in both major professional races and amateur events.

cars.name: Honda Civic Type R (EK) '98
description: Among Honda production cars, 'Type R' indicates models that have been tuned for performance. In the history of the Civic, the Type R first appeared in August 1997. This Type R was based on the 6th generation EK Civic and featured a B16B model 1.6L inline-4 DOHC 16-valve engine. Thanks to the VTEC system, it was able produce 182.4 BHP at 8,200 rpm without the use of forced induction. It saw much use in racing, and became a favourite for amateur racers as well.

description: Starting with the debut of the original in 1972, the Civic is Honda's longest selling car. 1997 saw the introduction of the first Type R model, based on the 6th generation Civic. The 'B16B' 1.6L inline-4 DOHC engine is able to produce 182.4 BHP despite being naturally aspirated. This version is an original tuned model by Gran Turismo, based on the Civic Type R (EK) (1997).

cars.name: Honda Civic Type R (FK2) '15
description: The Civic Type R is a sports model that has continued to excite enthusiasts around the world since its debut in 1997. The new car was developed from the 9th gen. European market 5-door model, undergoing rigorous wind-tunnel and circuit testing in the pursuit of performance. On the Nürburgring Nordschleife, the car ran a timed lap of just 7 minutes and 50.63 seconds, setting a new record for consumer model front-wheel drives.

cars.name: Honda Civic Type R (FL5) '22
description: The 6th generation model in the history of the Honda Civic Type R was released in September 2022. The car is based on the 'FL' 5-door hatchback model of the 11th generation Civic, which had already made its debut. The power unit is a 2L inline-4 turbo 'K20C' engine, producing both more power and torque than the 5th gen Type R at 325.4 BHP, 42.8 kgfm. The control parameters of the 4-wheel, independent active damper system have also been adjusted, providing better chassis performance.

cars.name: Honda Civic Type R Limited Edition (FK8) '20
description: The 5th Type R model Honda Civic was released in 2017. Previous models had simply aimed to increase the performance of the base model Civic, but the 5th generation Type R was developed from the ground up alongside the base model. The 'Limited Edition' model, released in 2020, had its performance increased further. The weight has been reduced by 20 kg through the removal of soundproofing and the use of special forged wheels. Minor adjustments have also been made to the suspension. The worldwide limited run of 1,000 units sold out almost immediately.

cars.name: Honda CR-V e:HEV EX・Black Edition '21
description: In the 1990s, Honda created the 'Creative Mover' category, releasing the original CR-V in 1995. This 2021 model of the 5th generation CR-V is the first to feature a hybrid power unit. The four-wheel drive option was also popular. The larger body has improved habitability, increased cargo space to over 1,100L. A 3-row 7-seater model is now available too. Thanks to its wealth of safety equipment and driver assists, it's the perfect car for everyday driving.

cars.name: Honda Fit Hybrid '14
description: The original Fit Hybrid was introduced in 2010, attracting much attention as the first hybrid in the B-segment. In 2013 came the 2nd generation Fit Hybrid, based on the 3rd generation Fit. This 2nd gen model is equipped with the Sport Hybrid i-DCD system which combined with the 1.5L i-VTEC engine produces 137.1 BHP. In the Japanese JC08 mode fuel efficiency test it achieved 2.8 l/100 km.

In 2013 came the 2nd generation Fit Hybrid, based on the 3rd generation Fit. This 2nd gen model is equipped with the Sport Hybrid i-DCD system which combined with the 1.5L i-VTEC engine produces 137.1 BHP. In the Japanese JC08 mode fuel efficiency test it achieved 2.8 l/100 km.

cars.name: Honda Honda Sports VGT
description: The 'Honda Sports Vision Gran Turismo' is a 2-seater coupé born from the collaborative efforts of the Honda design team and 'Gran Turismo'. Honda's 'Human Centred Design' direction is manifested in this car which uses human-centric package design. The car also strives to create the strong, exciting proportions that one would expect from a sports car.
cars.descriptionText: The 'Honda Sports Vision Gran Turismo' is a 2-seater coupé born from the collaborative efforts of the Honda design team and 'Gran Turismo'. Honda's 'Human Centred Design' direction is manifested in this car which uses human-centric package design. The car also strives to create the strong, exciting proportions that one would expect from a sports car.

cars.name: Honda Integra Type R (DC2) '95
description: A high performance model of the Integra introduced in 1995. The B18C engine from the Si has been upgraded with high compression pistons and conrods, along with double valve springs with all parts assembled by hand. Body rigidity has been increased while reducing body weight, and the suspension settings have been completely overhauled resulting in sure-footed handling with no tendency to understeer. It is also known as the road-going race car.

cars.name: Honda Integra Type R (DC2) '98
description: The car that familiarized the 'Type R' road-going race cars. Starting with the 1.8L VTEC B18C unit, the engines were hand-built, adding a high compression head and matching conrods to produce 197.2 BHP. The increased weight from parts like the helical LSD were cancelled out with the removal of comfort items to create incredible speed.

cars.name: Honda N-ONE RS '22
description: The N-ONE is a kei car that takes cues from Honda’s very first kei regulation model, the N360. The second generation N-ONE carries over the body panels from the original model while using a new chassis. The 2nd gen lineup also features the ‘RS’ sport model which uses the same close-ratio gears as the S660 sports car, with heavy duty synchronizers on second and third gear, along with a heavy duty clutch. The RS grade was also available on the original model, but the 2nd gen RS is notable for being the first kei car to combine a turbocharged front-wheel drive layout with a 6-speed manual transmission.

cars.name: Honda NSX '17
description: Making its official debut 25 years after the appearance of the original, the second generation NSX is a supercar featuring an electric four-wheel drive system called the 'Sports Hybrid' SH-AWD system, with independent left and right electric motors on the front wheels. With improvements not only in acceleration but also deceleration, the system enables torque vectoring which allows for stable cornering in all speed ranges.

cars.name: Honda NSX CONCEPT-GT '16
description: The NSX CONCEPT-GT is a racing machine developed by Honda based on the 2012 next-generation NSX concept, for competition in the GT500 class of the Super GT series. At its debut, the car was equipped with a hybrid system, but in 2016, the car would compete without it due to supply issues with the battery manufacturer. It went on to finish the season in 12th overall.

cars.name: Honda NSX Gr.3
description: A Gran Turismo Original, Honda's flagship NSX sports car has been modified to meet Gr.3 regulations. The car features a number of parts to increase aerodynamic effect, like the large front splitter which features cutouts to smooth airflow, and the swan-neck rear wing.
cars.descriptionText: A Gran Turismo Original, Honda's flagship NSX sports car has been modified to meet Gr.3 regulations. The car features a number of parts to increase aerodynamic effect, like the large front splitter which features cutouts to smooth airflow, and the swan-neck rear wing.

cars.name: Honda NSX Gr.4
description: A Gran Turismo Original, Honda's flagship NSX sports car has been modified to meet Gr.4 regulations. This design focuses on utilizing the characteristics of the base car, with only a small splitter and canards added along with the rear wing. In order to increase rigidity, a rear bulkhead has been added, along with a rear camera.

cars.name: Honda NSX Gr.B Rally Car
description: A Gran Turismo Original, Honda's flagship NSX sports car has been modified to meet Gr.B regulations. This car exhibits a rally-cross style exterior, but keeps the NSX's characteristic midship layout, simply converting it to four-wheel drive. The rear-heavy weight distribution remains unchanged, which should produce some exciting tail slides.

cars.name: Honda NSX GT500 '00
description: The 2000 All Japan Grand Touring Championship (JGTC) GT500 class was hotly contested by the top 3 Japanese automakers: Honda, Toyota and Nissan. In the same year, 5 teams competed in the NSX. Of those, the Castrol MUGEN NSX and Takata Dome NSX served as factory works cars. The Takata Dome NSX showed incredible potential, but the season champion was the Castrol MUGEN NSX featured here. It was able to claim the title through careful control of the weight handicaps incurred for good race results.

cars.name: Honda NSX GT500 '08
description: A version of the NSX that competed in the 2008 Super GT championship. The NSX was at a disadvantage this season, along with using the previous year's frame, it was hit with weight handicaps and a narrow restrictor, but engine and aero improvements allowed it to remain competitive. The EPSON NSX finished in 2nd place in Round 8 at Autopolis.

cars.name: Honda NSX Type R '02
description: This second wave NSX Type R was introduced in 2002. In addition to the weight reductions and rigidity improvements from the original Type R, this model has received an aerodynamic overhaul producing an incredible amount of downforce for a road car. Carbon fibre parts have been used throughout areas like the bonnet and rear wing. At a time attack on the Nürburgring Nordschleife, this car was able to beat the 8 minute mark which had previously been considered the limit for road cars.

cars.name: Honda NSX Type R '92
description: A high performance version of the NSX introduced in November 1992. The weight has been reduced by 120 kg through the removal of luxury features and lightening of functional parts. Additionally, every single engine has been carefully balanced to provide optimal feeling at high revolutions. A legendary model whose importance cannot be understated in the story of the NSX's evolution.

cars.name: Honda RA272 '65
description: In 1965, this legendary machine earned Honda their first F1 victory. This car reuses the basic frame of the RA271, Honda's first F1 car, but has increased performance through the implementation of weight reduction across its component parts, moving to outboard rear suspension, and tuning the 'clockwork-like' 1.5L V12 engine. Though it suffered from stability issues at the start of the season, major improvements were made midway through, and it would eventually claim a well-earned victory in round 10 at the Mexican Grand Prix.

cars.name: Honda S2000 '99
description: Honda's popular 'S' series of the 1960s was revived in 1999. Every part of the S2000 was specially developed to provide the best sporting performance, and as its name suggests, it houses a 2L inline-4 DOHC engine. The 6-speed manual transmission is also a bespoke setup, using a secondary reduction gear to ensure both shift feel and reduced weight. Touches like these provide a glimpse into the dedication of the designers.

cars.name: Honda S660 '15
description: The S660 is Honda's first convertible ultralight 'kei' class sports car in 19 years, after production of the Beat ceased in 1996. The newly designed body is extremely rigid, while managing to keep weight in the low 800 kg range. Furthermore, the car features a torque vectoring system that allows it to take corners at speeds unthinkable for a 'kei' car, while achieving neutral and enjoyable handling.

cars.name: Honda S800 '66
description: Honda's line of sports cars started in 1963 with the super compact 2-seater S500. It was followed by the S600 with a larger engine for more power, then the S800 which features four-wheel independent suspension. With a larger engine than the S600 and a short shift lever easily reachable from the low slung seats, the S800 was met with worldwide acclaim.

cars.name: Hyundai ELANTRA N '23
description: Introduced as the high-performance model of the 7th generation ELANTRA, the ELANTRA N was developed to embody the N brand philosophy of 'making cornering fun.' Equipped with a 2L turbo engine capable of producing 276.1 BHP of power and 40.0 kgfm of torque, it has a 0-62.1 mph acceleration speed of just 5.3 seconds despite its front-wheel drive layout. The car is available in 6-speed manual or 8-speed DCT transmission variants. Furthermore, its running gear features electronically controlled dampers and an eLSD, along with a heavy-duty braking system.

cars.name: Hyundai ELANTRA N TC '24
description: The Hyundai ELANTRA N TC is a special model built for racing. Based on the ELANTRA N, which is able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in just 5.3s despite using a front-wheel drive layout, the TC model has been specially outfitted according to touring car race regulations. The wide body is equipped with a carbon fibre splitter and large rear wing to greatly improve high speed cornering stability. This model has also been fitted with a 6-speed sequential gear box, with the braking and cooling parts also upgraded to endurance racing standards.

cars.name: Hyundai Genesis Coupe 3.8 '13
description: This sports coupé uses the same platform as the Genesis luxury sedan. 345 mm shorter than the sedan and with a wheelbase 115 mm shorter, the car achieves excellent agility by combining a front-engine, rear-wheel drive layout with four wheel independent suspension. In 2012, the car received minor changes, increasing engine power output. With a 3.8L V6 producing roughly 345.2 BHP the car achieves performance close to supercar levels.

In 2012, the car received minor changes, increasing engine power output. With a 3.8L V6 producing roughly 345.2 BHP the car achieves performance close to supercar levels.

cars.name: Hyundai Genesis Gr.3
description: Hyundai's rear-wheel drive Genesis sports car has been modified to meet Gr.3 regulations for this Gran Turismo Original. With its over 2,800 mm long wheelbase, the car achieves both high stability and a powerful downforce from its large floor surface area. The V6 engine, though naturally aspirated, still produces over 493.1 BHP. It's a balanced machine that can handle both corners and straights.

The V6 engine, though naturally aspirated, still produces over 493.1 BHP. It's a balanced machine that can handle both corners and straights.

cars.name: Hyundai Genesis Gr.4
description: Hyundai's rear-wheel drive Genesis sports car has been modified to meet Gr.4 regulations for this Gran Turismo Original. Though externally appearing to be a touring car, it possesses a number of features that put it closer to Gr.3 like its paddle shift transmission. In the real world, the Genesis is a popular choice for drifting, and this Gr.4 edition is just as adept, it's not just for races.

cars.name: Hyundai Genesis Gr.B Rally Car
description: Hyundai's rear-wheel drive Genesis sports car has been modified to meet Gr.B regulations for this Gran Turismo Original. Along with a four-wheel drive conversion, this car features a number of modern rally car trends. The front fenders feature organic curves maximising downforce, while the wide track at over 2,050 mm provides extra manoeuvrability to the body's long wheelbase.

cars.name: Hyundai HYUNDAI N 2025 VGT
description: Created to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Hyundai, this model also represents the passion of Hyundai's 'N' high performance division. Powered by hydrogen fuel cells and super capacitors which store energy from the regenerative brakes, the car achieves a total power output of 650kW (871.8 BHP) through the electric motors on each wheel. Thanks to its compact and lightweight fuel cell stacks and CFRP monocoque frame, the car weighs just 972 kg.

cars.name: Hyundai HYUNDAI N 2025 VGT (Gr.1)
description: Originally born from a collaboration between Hyundai and Gran Turismo, the N 2025 Vision Gran Turismo has been modified to meet Gr.1 regulations in this original model. According to Gr.1 rules, the variable wing has been fixed in place. The drivetrain carries over the four-wheel drive setup, allowing this car to perform as if it were glued to the road.

cars.name: Hyundai IONIQ 5 N '24
description: This performance model was introduced 2 years after the original release of the IONIQ 5. The four-wheel drive system uses electric motors on the front and rear axles allowing for freely adjustable torque distribution. When set to a rear bias, this allows for the over 2-ton body to be drifted. This unusual electric SUV also attempts to retain the excitement of a conventional engine car, offering a simulated 8-speed DCT and exhaust noises.

cars.name: Infiniti INFINITI CONCEPT VGT
description: The INFINITI CONCEPT Vision Gran Turismo was born from the Infiniti premium car brand under the philosophy of 'designing a pure INFINITI GT car'. The designers of the car aimed to create a full racing machine while also attempting to create a seductive racing language for Infiniti.

cars.name: Italdesign Italdesign VGT Off-road Mode
description: A Vision Gran Turismo model from the famous Italian design house. The car's name stems from the Latin 'xenium,' meaning 'gift for the guest' and the design 'wraps up' the driver and engine in carbon fibre and aluminium tape. Behind the cockpit sits a V10 engine, while 2 electric motors sit in the front. The chassis can be set to 4 different configurations to tackle all terrain conditions.

cars.name: Jaguar D-type '54
description: The Jaguar D-type is a racing sports car introduced in 1954 as the successor to the C-type, with 64 units produced in total. It uses a tube frame with a monocoque construction. The body design by Malcolm Sayer is recognizable by the fin to the rear of the driver's seat. It debuted at the 1954 24 Hours of Le Mans and would claim victory 3 years running up until 1957.

cars.name: Jaguar E-type Coupé '61
description: A 2-seater sports car released in 1961. Its refined stylings had a profound impact on sports car design all over the world. The 3.6L inline-6 DOHC engine produces 265.3 BHP, propelling the lightweight 1,219 kg body to speeds of up to 130.5 mph. 7820 Series I models were produced, with most of them carried over to the United States.

cars.name: Jaguar F-type Gr.3
description: A Gran Turismo Original, Jaguar's new-generation F-type coupé has been modified to meet Gr.3 rules. This race car retains the beauty of the original design, while adding aggressive aesthetics such as the wide fenders. Another standout feature is the swan-neck wing which juts out from the tail lights, providing strength and downforce.

cars.name: Jaguar F-type Gr.4
description: A Gran Turismo Original, Jaguar's new-generation F-type coupé has been modified to meet Gr.4 rules. The car has been given a fierce new look with matte grey paint and the front grille garnishes removed. On the performance side however, it's actually quite manageable in the corners and has excellent straight-line speed.

cars.name: Jaguar F-type R '14
description: This sports car was introduced in 2012 as a spiritual successor to the classic E-type which had ceased production in 1975. At first, it was only available as a convertible, but just over one year later a coupé model was added. This model is the high-performance F-type R Coupé that was announced at the same time. The supercharged 5L V8 engine produces 542.4 BHP and is capable of a 0-62.1 mph time of 4.2s, though its top speed is limited to 186.4 mph.

cars.name: Jaguar Jaguar VGT Coupé
description: This Vision Gran Turismo was created by Jaguar Advanced Design. This fully electric model carries on the lineage of historic Jaguar race cars like the C, D and E-types, featuring not only elegance by a low centre of mass and perfect weight distribution. Sitting in the cockpit, all information necessary to the driver is displayed near seamlessly over the road ahead, resulting in a thrilling race experience through digital means.

cars.name: Jaguar Jaguar VGT Roadster
description: Jaguar's third Vision Gran Turismo takes inspiration from the Jaguar D-type. This electric open single seater with aero screen is powered by 3 electric motors producing over 986.2 BHP. Behind the seat is a modern interpretation of the classic D-type's iconic fin, and the focused cockpit controls also represent the history and traditions of Jaguar.

cars.name: Jaguar Jaguar VGT SV
description: Jaguar's second Vision Gran Turismo was designed by Jaguar with engineering touches from Jaguar Special Vehicles (SV). The elegant body design remains, but the aerodynamics have been completely redesigned to produce maximum downforce. The powertrain utilizes the company's experience in Formula E, featuring 4 electric motors. The battery also features the latest liquid nitrogen cooling system.

cars.name: Jaguar XJ13 '66
description: Completed in 1966, this is Jaguar's first mid-engine racing sports car. The low, streamlined body, similar to that of the E-type, is equipped with a 495.1 BHP 5L V12 DOHC engine. While it was expected to perform well on the circuit, management at the time were not interested in motorsports and so the project was cancelled. Often called Jaguar's most beautiful race car, it would disappear into the annals of history without ever competing in even a single race.

cars.name: Jaguar XJ220 '92
description: The XJ220 was named for its record as the fastest road car of its time, reaching 220 mph (220 mph). Production was handled by Jaguar Sport, a joint venture between Tom Walkinshaw Racing and Jaguar. It uses the 3.5L V6 turbo engine from the XJR-11 Group C car, mounted to an aluminium honeycomb and carbon Kevlar composite construction chassis. From 1993 onwards it would also compete in GT races including the 24 Hours of Le Mans.

cars.name: Jaguar XJR-9 '88
description: After their successes at Le Mans in the 1950s, Jaguar would eventually return in 1986 with a Group C machine. They would hit their peak in 1988 with this XJR-9. Its excellent aerodynamics and endurability from its simple construction would earn it victory in the Le Mans 24 Hours. This victory earned a place in the history books as they had managed to defeat the long-running champions of Le Mans, Porsche.

cars.name: Jeep Willys MB '45
description: The roots of the SUV category lie in this compact four-wheel drive car developed under a request by the US military in 1940. Of the test models produced by Bantam, Ford and Willys, the best performer was the Willys MB, an upgraded version of the MA, leading to the production of over 360,000 such cars. Its superb combination of simple, robust construction, using a ladder frame with rigid axles, and four-wheel drive would create a truly historic car, whose spirit has lived on for generations.

cars.name: KTM X-BOW R '12
description: The X-BOW is the first sportscar developed by Austrian motorcycle manufacturer KTM. Pronounced 'Crossbow', it is designed after the mechanical bow weapon of the same name. With no doors or windows, this 2-seater does away with all unnecessary features. The car has excellent handling and is able to take a maximum of 1.5 lateral Gs when cornering.

cars.name: Lamborghini Aventador LP 700-4 '11
description: The Aventador debuted at the 2011 Geneva Motor Show, succeeding the Murciélago. The body has been almost completely redesigned, featuring a carbon monocoque with front and rear aluminium subframes instead of the previous model's steel tube space frame. With the car now made mostly of carbon fibre and aluminium, it is also very light for a car of this type with a dry weight of only 1,575 kg.

cars.name: Lamborghini Aventador LP 750-4 SV '15
description: Lamborghini's flagship models have traditionally always featured a V12 engine, but the highest performance models feature the 'Superveloce' (SV) badge. Meaning 'super fast' in Italian, this naming has its roots in the legendary classic Miura. The Aventador's SV model was introduced in 2015 and features an extra 49.3 BHP over the base model for a maximum output of 739.6 BHP.

cars.name: Lamborghini Countach 25th Anniversary '88
description: Introduced at the 1971 Geneva Motor Show, the Lamborghini Countach is the prototypical supercar. The first production model, the LP400, was introduced in 1974 in a limited production run of just 150 cars. 1985 saw the release of the 5000 Quattrovalvole which produced 448.7 BHP from a 5,200 cc engine. The final model was the 25th Anniversary, released in 1988 with 657 produced in total.

cars.name: Lamborghini Countach LP400 '74
description: First unveiled at the 1971 Geneva Motor Show, the Lamborghini Countach is a truly historic supercar whose design and performance attracted massive attention from the world over. Taken from a word in the Italian Piedmont dialect meaning surprise, the 'Countach' did exactly as its name suggests and Marcello Gandini's sensational near-futuristic design would have a major impact on super sports cars for years to come.

cars.name: Lamborghini Diablo GT '00
description: Based on the Diablo GT2, a full race car developed for FIA GT Championships, the Diablo GT was detuned and modified for street driving. Its 6L V12 engine produces 567.1 BHP and 64 kgfm of torque. At 1,490 kg, 40 kg lighter than the Diablo SV, the car can reach an amazing top speed of 210 mph.

cars.name: Lamborghini Gallardo LP 560-4 '08
description: Released in 2008, the Lamborghini Gallardo LP 560-4 offers an increase of 39.4 BHP in power over the previous model. While it carries over the four-wheel drive powertrain, the transmission has been replaced with a 6-speed E-gear unit which provides 40% faster gear shifts. Weight reduction has not been ignored either, with the body now weighing 1,410 kg and the top speed increased to 201.9 mph. This car offers the highest performance in a streamlined design.

cars.name: Lamborghini Huracán Gr.4
description: Lamborghini's entry-level, mid-ship four-wheel drive Huracán has been transformed into a Gr.4 regulation machine for this Gran Turismo Original. The high stability from the four-wheel drive layout, and the agile cornering ability of the mid-ship layout's weight distribution result in a well-balanced and well-behaved machine.

cars.name: Lamborghini Huracán GT3 '15
description: Unveiled in January 2015, the Huracán GT3 is, as its name suggests, a racing version of the Huracán built to FIA GT3 specifications. While the body is made from an aluminium and carbon fibre hybrid construction like the road car, the body width has been increased. The car also uses numerous parts to improve aerodynamics, which give it a new, more aggressive appearance than the road car.

cars.name: Lamborghini Huracán LP 610-4 '15
description: The Huracán was announced in 2014 to replace the Gallardo. Construction changed from an aluminium space frame to an aluminium and carbon hybrid, which allowed for a 50% gain in rigidity and 10% less weight. The midship-mounted engine is a 5.2L V10 producing 601.6 BHP/57 kgfm. This power is directed through a 7-speed dual-clutch transmission and through the Haldex 5 AWD system to the ground.

cars.name: Lamborghini Lambo V12 VGT
description: This Vision Gran Turismo was born from the passion and technical prowess of the Team of Centro Stile Lamborghini. Though the chief design motifs of the 'Y' and hexagonal shapes, it also resembles the silhouette of the classic Stratos Zero in its side profile. The powertrain uses a V12 engine with a supercapacitor hybrid system, derived from the Sián FKP 37. In a stylish touch, a glimpse of this system can be seen from outside the vehicle.

cars.name: Lamborghini Miura P400 Bertone Prototype '67
description: Lamborghini's first supercar released in 1966, the Miura P400 was a revolutionary development that instantly made the Lamborghini name famous across the world. A number of incredible people were brought together to make this machine including Marcello Gandini, then chief designer at Bertone, Gian Paolo Dallara, who designed the chassis, and Paolo Stanzani who would later develop the Countach.

cars.name: Lamborghini Murciélago LP 640 '09
description: A high performance version of Lamborghini's flagship Murciélago, introduced in 2006. Originally debuting with 6.2L displacement, the transversely mounted V12 engine was enlarged to 6.5L to produce 631.2 BHP. The exterior was given an aerodynamic overhaul and other improvements were made to the gearbox and electronics to match.

cars.name: Lamborghini Urus '18
description: Introduced in 2018, the Urus is Lamborghini's super SUV. It features the first use of forced induction in Lamborghini history, equipped with a 4L V8 twin-turbo engine capable of a 0-62.1 mph time of 3.6s and a top speed of 189.5 mph which was record breaking at its debut. With its active air suspension, rear wheel steering and torque vectoring systems, it was also capable of superior handling and cornering performance.

cars.name: Lamborghini Veneno '14
description: The Veneno was a special limited edition model to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the founding of Lamborghini. Only 3 were ever sold. Based on the Aventador and using the same chassis and powertrain, the engine output was increased to 739.6 BHP, while its weight was reduced with improvements such as a carbon fibre monocoque. This made the Veneno 125 kg lighter than the Aventador at 1,450 kg.

cars.name: Lancia Delta HF Integrale Evoluzione '91
description: After a streak of victories at the WRC thanks to the incredible performance of the Lancia Delta, Lancia would go on to face stiff competition from Toyota in 1991. This led to the development of the ultimate Delta, the HF Integrale Evoluzione. Along with improvements to engine output also came an overhaul of the front-rear power distribution and a stark improvement in handling. The Evoluzione debuted at the 1992 WRC, and would contribute to the company's record of ongoing victories.

cars.name: Lancia Delta HF Integrale Rally Car '92
description: Lancia converted the Delta to four-wheel drive and equipped it with a turbocharger to create the HF 4WD, a high performance model which was entered the 1987 WRC Group A class. The Delta HF 4WD would later evolve again, becoming the Integrale, which added blister fenders and more engine power. The body and suspension would receive major upgrades each year. Thanks to these efforts, the car would win 8 races in the '92 season, claiming a 6th consecutive World Rally Championship title.

cars.name: Lancia Stratos '73
description: Bertone unveiled their 'Stratos Zero' in 1970. This wedge-shaped concept car would later go into full production as the 'Stratos'. The body is constructed from a rigid monocoque frame with fibreglass exterior panels and houses a 2.4L V6 DOHC engine. Thanks to the incredible cornering ability provided by its short wheelbase, it performed incredibly well in rallying.

cars.name: Lexus LC500 '17
description: The LC500 is a luxury sports car that was unveiled at the 2016 Geneva Motor Show. While it has a flowing streamlined coupé body, the front and rear overhangs have been shortened to allow for a front midship layout with 2+2 seating. The body also uses a variety of materials to lighten the body while also providing ample rigidity.

While it has a flowing streamlined coupé body, the front and rear overhangs have been shortened to allow for a front midship layout with 2+2 seating. The body also uses a variety of materials to lighten the body while also providing ample rigidity.

cars.name: Lexus LF-LC GT VGT
description: The Lexus LF-LC GT 'Vision Gran Turismo' is a dream car designed by Lexus in view of competition in the Super GT and the 24 Hours of Nürburgring. Based on the LF-LC luxury coupé concept, this new idea was born from the Lexus design philosophy by CALTY DESIGN combined with a more practical approach taken from Lexus Racing.
cars.descriptionText: The Lexus LF-LC GT 'Vision Gran Turismo' is a dream car designed by Lexus in view of competition in the Super GT and the 24 Hours of Nürburgring. Based on the LF-LC luxury coupé concept, this new idea was born from the Lexus design philosophy by CALTY DESIGN combined with a more practical approach taken from Lexus Racing.

cars.name: Lexus LFA '10
description: This supreme sports car was created to carry on from the fanfare and performance of the Toyota 2000GT. It uses a carbon fibre body, produced through automated methods rather than by hand, with the transaxle and radiator positioned in the rear to create a 48:52 front-to-rear weight distribution. The engine is a 4.8L V10 unit with a 72-degree bank angle. The beautiful roar of the engine was tuned with the help of musical instrument maker Yamaha. Only 500 cars were produced.

cars.name: Lexus RC F '14
description: The RC F is a high performance coupé announced by Lexus at the 2014 Detroit Auto Show. The engine is a refined version of the 5L V8 from the IS F, producing 449.7 BHP/53 kgfm, a 32.5 BHP/1.5 kgfm improvement over the base engine. This is combined with an 8-speed automatic transmission with paddle shifters. Excluding the LFA, this is the most sports oriented model in the history of the Lexus line-up.

This is combined with an 8-speed automatic transmission with paddle shifters. Excluding the LFA, this is the most sports oriented model in the history of the Lexus line-up.

cars.name: Lexus RC F Gr.4
description: This Gran Turismo Original is a version of the Lexus RC F high performance coupé, modified for Gr.4 competition. With the immense torque of the high displacement V8 engine, this car excels in straight line acceleration. The base colour is the same orange that Lexus uses on their special models.
cars.descriptionText: This Gran Turismo Original is a version of the Lexus RC F high performance coupé, modified for Gr.4 competition. cars.name: Lexus RC F GT3 '17
description: From 2015, Lexus began test competition of a specially made race car based on the RC F. They would use their experience from these tests to further development of the car which made its debut in 2017 as the RC F GT3. Emil Frey Racing who had served as the development team on the RC F GT3 took the car to the International GT Open. They would finish 3rd in the team rankings.

cars.name: Lexus RC F GT3 prototype '16
description: The RC F GT3 is a GT3 spec race car developed from the Lexus RC F. This prototype was produced before homologation in order to test performance. This car won the 9th round of the VLN (Nürburgring Endurance Series). At that time it competed with the bare carbon bodywork, but the version seen here features the Emil Frey Racing livery.

cars.name: Lexus RC F GT500 '16
description: The Lexus RC F competed in the Super GT GT500 class from 2014 to 2016. New regulations introduced in 2014 meant that the weight of the monocoque and the major parts were shared with the DTM model. The engine used was the same 2L inline-4 turbo unit as Super Formula cars. The 2016 au TOM'S RC F collected a number of points across the season including 2nd place in Round 6, finishing the season in 5th place overall.

cars.name: Lexus SC430 GT500 '08
description: A Super GT race car that competed in the 2008 season. Based on experience from the previous year, the front and rear overhangs were lengthened to improve aerodynamics, and the compact body did very well on high speed circuits. While it was unable to score any outright victories, it earned enough points over the season to win the team title.

cars.name: Maserati A6GCS/53 Spyder '54
description: This Maserati A6GCS/53 Spyder won the 'Gran Turismo Trophy' at the 2014 Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance. The beautiful aluminium Spyder body was created by Carrozzeria Fantuzzi, while the 167.7 BHP engine was made by Gioacchino Colombo. It competed under the Maserati factory team, winning 5 class victories and 3 overall victories across the 1954 season.

The beautiful aluminium Spyder body was created by Carrozzeria Fantuzzi, while the 167.7 BHP engine was made by Gioacchino Colombo. It competed under the Maserati factory team, winning 5 class victories and 3 overall victories across the 1954 season.

cars.name: Maserati GranTurismo S '08
description: A high performance version of the GranTurismo which was introduced at the 2008 Geneva Motor Show. The V8 DOHC engine's displacement has been increased to 4.7L, and the transmission and rear differential have been combined in a transaxle unit. It is also the first in the series to use the 2-pedal semi-automatic 'MC Shift' system.
cars.descriptionText: A high performance version of the GranTurismo which was introduced at the 2008 Geneva Motor Show. The V8 DOHC engine's displacement has been increased to 4.7L, and the transmission and rear differential have been combined in a transaxle unit. It is also the first in the series to use the 2-pedal semi-automatic 'MC Shift' system.

cars.name: Maserati MC20 '20
description: This is Maserati's first mid-ship sports car in 15 years since the MC12. The streamlined body is designed by Dallara to produce a strong downforce without relying on external aero parts. The carbon monocoque weighs just 100 kg by itself and is equipped with the newly developed 3L V6 twin-turbo engine featuring F1 style pre-chambers.

The streamlined body is designed by Dallara to produce a strong downforce without relying on external aero parts. The carbon monocoque weighs just 100 kg by itself and is equipped with the newly developed 3L V6 twin-turbo engine featuring F1 style pre-chambers.

cars.name: Maserati Merak SS '80
description: This midship sports car debuted in 1972 as the sister car to the Bora. While the Bora had a V8, the Merak used the smaller 3L V6 engine from the Citroën SM and implemented a 2+2 layout with the extra space available. The SS is a high performance model introduced in 1975. Engine output has been increased through a higher compression ratio, raising the top speed from 139.8 mph to 155.3 mph.

cars.name: Mazda 787B '91
description: Completing the 1991 24 Hours of Le Mans without any mechanical trouble, the 787B would become the first car to take the overall victory in this race from a Japanese manufacturer. Mazda who began competing at Le Mans with rotary engines in 1974 developed the 787 as their last chance for a rotary victory at Le Mans, as its regulations would soon change against rotary engines. While they failed to achieve their goal in the 1990 race, the 787 underwent drastic improvements to become the 787B.

cars.name: Mazda Atenza Gr.3
description: Mazda's Atenza global sedan has been modified for Gr.3 use in this Gran Turismo Original. The exterior features aggressive yet streamlined aerodynamics which follow Mazda's 'KODO' design philosophy. To increase body rigidity, a bulkhead has been added at the back of the cockpit, along with a rear view camera to increase visibility.

cars.name: Mazda Atenza Gr.3 Road Car
description: This is a Gr.3 homologation model of the Atenza, based on Mazda's global market saloon and modified to meet Gr.3 regulations. As a base for a true race car, this model has been transformed into a monster saloon producing over 400 horsepower. The car is notable for its design which has even taken the flow of reflections on its bodywork into consideration.

cars.name: Mazda Atenza Gr.4
description: Mazda's Atenza global sedan has been modified for Gr.3 use in this Gran Turismo Original. Being based on a four-wheel drive system, this touring car has excellent traction. A Gr.3 style large front grille and bonnet vents have been added to help the 4-cylinder turbo engine produce its incredible 394.5 BHP.

cars.name: Mazda Atenza Sedan XD L Package '15
description: The 3rd generation Atenza featured Mazda's SKYACTIV-D diesel engine. Nicknamed XD (cross-d) it was produced in 3 trim levels with the L package being the highest grade. With environmentally-oriented improvements such as idling stop and i-ELOOP regenerative braking, the vehicles equipped with SKYACTIV-D were able to achieve a fuel economy of 4.5 l/100 km in 'JC08 mode' testing.
cars.descriptionText: The 3rd generation Atenza featured Mazda's SKYACTIV-D diesel engine. Nicknamed XD (cross-d) it was produced in 3 trim levels with the L package being the highest grade. With environmentally-oriented improvements such as idling stop and i-ELOOP regenerative braking, the vehicles equipped with SKYACTIV-D were able to achieve a fuel economy of 4.5 l/100 km in 'JC08 mode' testing.

cars.name: Mazda CX-30 X Smart Edition '21
description: The CX-30 is a crossover SUV introduced to fill the gap between the CX-3 and CX-5. While relatively compact, it exhibits the flowing 'KODO Design' apparent in its front mask and the reflections of light across its body. The CX-30 X Smart Edition was introduced in 2021. This version features the SKYACTIV-X engine along with many driver assists and an improved pedal feel.
cars.descriptionText: The CX-30 is a crossover SUV introduced to fill the gap between the CX-3 and CX-5. While relatively compact, it exhibits the flowing 'KODO Design' apparent in its front mask and the reflections of light across its body. The CX-30 X Smart Edition was introduced in 2021. This version features the SKYACTIV-X engine along with many driver assists and an improved pedal feel.

cars.name: Mazda Demio XD Touring '15
description: The Mazda Demio received a full model change in 2014, reaching its 4th generation. It featured the new 'KODO design' philosophy and had looks to rival European cars. One of the most notable features was the newly developed 1.5L diesel turbo 'SKYACTIV-D 1.5' engine. It would prove to be popular due to its superior fuel efficiency, with diesel models accounting for over 60% of orders.

It would prove to be popular due to its superior fuel efficiency, with diesel models accounting for over 60% of orders.

cars.name: Mazda Eunos Roadster (NA) '89
description: This automotive masterpiece revived the lightweight sports cars for the end of the 20th century. Originally debuting in 1989 with a 1.6L engine, displacement was changed to 1.8L in 1993. The attraction of this car is in its fundamentals, the transmission and rear differential are linked together by the aluminium powerplant frame, and all 4 wheels feature double wishbone suspension and disc brakes, all resulting in direct and responsive handling.

cars.name: Mazda LM55 VGT
description: The Mazda LM55 Vision Gran Turismo was designed by Mazda as a vision of the future, aiming for total victory at the 24 Hours of Le Mans. The car's dynamic silhouette was inspired by Mazda's KODO design philosophy and its front grille features a reinterpretation of the front end design used across all Mazda models of recent years.
cars.descriptionText: The Mazda LM55 Vision Gran Turismo was designed by Mazda as a vision of the future, aiming for total victory at the 24 Hours of Le Mans. The car's dynamic silhouette was inspired by Mazda's KODO design philosophy and its front grille features a reinterpretation of the front end design used across all Mazda models of recent years.

cars.name: Mazda LM55 VGT (Gr.1)
description: A Gr.1 modified version of the LM55 Vision Gran Turismo, Mazda's vision of a modern rotary prototype car. This car has the superb cornering characteristics that one would expect from a Mazda, along with the strong traction provided by the four-wheel drive system. Quickly darting around corners and dashing down the straights, it is truly the modern vision of a 'rotary rocket.'
cars.descriptionText: A Gr.1 modified version of the LM55 Vision Gran Turismo, Mazda's vision of a modern rotary prototype car. cars.name: Mazda MAZDA SPIRIT RACING ROADSTER 12R '25
description: This car was created by MAZDA SPIRIT RACING, an initiative started in 2021 to represent Mazda's motorsports activities. Though based on the ND Roadster, it features a 2L block that was not normally available on Japanese soft-tops, with specially designed camshafts, cylinder head, pistons, and exhaust manifold. This results in a power of 197.2 BHP, somewhere near the limit of what is practical in a production model. Other adjustments have been made across the entirety of the chassis that draw on the company's deep well of knowledge gained from Super Endurance racing.

cars.name: Mazda MAZDA3 '19
description: The 4th generation MAZDA3 was introduced in 2018. The later introduced mild hybrid 'M Hybrid' model gained worldwide attention with its 'SKYACTIV-X' engine that used spark-controlled compression ignition. This 'X Burgundy Selection' is a limited edition model based on the X grade, which features the SKYACTIV-X, and a burgundy coloured interior that exudes a mature elegance.
cars.descriptionText: The 4th generation MAZDA3 was introduced in 2018. cars.name: Mazda MAZDA3 Gr.4
description: This GT Original car takes inspiration from the 'MAZDA3 Bio concept' that competed in the ST-Q class of Japan's Super Endurance series. This car uses next generation 100% biodiesel fuel derived from waste cooking oils. The body also features environmentally conscious hybrid materials. This ambitious project aims to blend carbon neutrality in motorsports with top performance as a race car.

cars.name: Mazda Roadster NR-A (ND) '22
description: A motorsports base car introduced to the 4th generation Roadster lineup. The drivetrain has been upgraded to circuit driving specs, along with adding a larger radiator and disc brakes. The suspension features height-adjustable dampers from Bilstein. Further upgrades were implemented in 2022, adding Kinematic Posture Control to greatly increase rear stability.

cars.name: Mazda Roadster S (ND) '15
description: The 4th generation 'ND' Roadster was first unveiled in April 2014 at the New York Auto Show. Along with its size, the body styling which uses a wide and low design with graceful curves received worldwide praise when it was revealed in September the same year. Pre-orders began in March 2015. The most basic trim level, the S grade features simplified equipment and is also the only model weighing less than 1t with a kerb weight of 990 kg.

cars.name: Mazda Roadster Touring Car
description: The Eunos Roadster (NA Special Package) '89 has been specially tuned by Gran Turismo to create this original machine. The engine and suspension have been modified, and aero parts have been added, but the car still retains the Roadster's characteristic 'Jinba Ittai' responsive handling. A spartan machine that can even take on touring car races.

cars.name: Mazda RX-7 GT-X (FC) '90
description: The FC3S, the 2nd generation of the RX-7, debuted in October of 1985. With a new futuristic look, the car was smaller than the original only in length, being both taller and wider. This new model was also 200 kg heavier. To make up for the extra weight, the car was equipped with the new 13B engine. Performance was improved by enlarging each rotary chamber to 654 cc, and combined with a turbocharger it produced a maximum 182.4 BHP with a maximum torque of 25 kgfm.
cars.descriptionText: The FC3S, the 2nd generation of the RX-7, debuted in October of 1985. With a new futuristic look, the car was smaller than the original only in length, being both taller and wider. This new model was also 200 kg heavier. To make up for the extra weight, the car was equipped with the new 13B engine. Performance was improved by enlarging each rotary chamber to 654 cc, and combined with a turbocharger it produced a maximum 182.4 BHP with a maximum torque of 25 kgfm.

cars.name: Mazda RX-7 Spirit R Type A (FD) '02
description: The FD3S, the 3rd generation RX-7, debuted in December 1991. While the body width was increased to allow wider tyres, the use of aluminium parts across the body reduced its weight significantly down to nearly 1,200 kg. Though the engine is a 13B like the FC3S, the use of a sequential twin turbo system increased power output to 251.5 BHP/30 kgfm. The lightest model, the Type S, has a power-weight ratio of 4.97 kg/BHP, making it the most powerful in RX-7 history.

cars.name: Mazda RX-8 Spirit R '12
description: Released in 2011, this is the final special edition model of the Mazda RX-8. The 6-speed manual Type RS base model, which features Bilstein shocks, and the 6-speed automatic Type E base model featuring luxuries like leather seats, have both been fitted with special interior and exterior furnishings. Originally slated for a run of 1,000 units, the announcement that the RX-8 would be discontinued in 2012 boosted sales, leading to an additional run of 1,000 more.

cars.name: Mazda RX-VISION '15
description: A rotary sports concept unveiled at the 2015 Tokyo Motor Show. All unnecessary lines and faces have been chiselled away from the elegant long nose, short deck form to create Mazda's vision of the ideal rear-wheel drive sports car. Equipped with the SKYACTIV-R next-generation rotary engines, the car provides a vision of the future of rotary power.

cars.name: Mazda RX-VISION GT3 CONCEPT
description: The MAZDA RX-VISION is a concept car announced at the 2015 Tokyo Motor Show. The beauty of the base design has been given a more aggressive reinterpretation as a race car. In order to meet the power demands of the Gr.3 class, the lightweight body has been equipped with a 4-rotor engine inspired by the classic 787B engine concept and recreated using the latest SKYACTIV technology to provide unprecedented performance.

cars.name: Mazda RX500 '70
description: A concept car celebrating the 50th anniversary of the founding of Mazda. The bullet-shaped body sits on a steel tube space frame and houses a 10A type rotary engine built for the 24 Hours of Spa and producing power in the range of 246.5 BHP. While it had been seen in 3 different body colours, further investigation revealed that it had been the same body repainted each time.

cars.name: McLaren 650S '14
description: The 650S is a McLaren supercar announced in 2014. The 3.8L V8 twin-turbo engine from previous models has been tuned to 641 BHP/69 kgfm to live up to its name. Combined with a 7-speed dual clutch transmission for super smooth shifting, the car goes from 0 to 62.1 mph in 3.0 seconds with a 400 m time of 10.5 seconds, and a top speed of 206.9 mph.

Combined with a 7-speed dual clutch transmission for super smooth shifting, the car goes from 0 to 62.1 mph in 3.0 seconds with a 400 m time of 10.5 seconds, and a top speed of 206.9 mph.

cars.name: McLaren 650S Gr.4
description: A Gran Turismo Original, this Gr.4 car is based on the 650S, McLaren's mid-level super car. Featuring McLaren's factory racing colour, this colourful machine offers predictable handling and stability to easily conquer any corner. The interior furnishings, fuel cap and jack up points are all GT3 level equipment.
cars.descriptionText: A Gran Turismo Original, this Gr.4 car is based on the 650S, McLaren's mid-level super car. Featuring McLaren's factory racing colour, this colourful machine offers predictable handling and stability to easily conquer any corner. The interior furnishings, fuel cap and jack up points are all GT3 level equipment.

cars.name: McLaren 650S GT3 '15
description: The 650S GT3 is an FIA-GT3 regulation ready vehicle developed from the McLaren 650S supercar. While it uses the same 3.8L V8 twin-turbo engine, it has been detuned to meet GT3 regulations, producing the same 493.1 BHP as the MP4-12C GT3. It also features numerous endurance oriented improvements across the car. The 2015 650S GT3 achieved victory at GT Asia the same year and the Bathurst 12 Hour at the start of 2016.
cars.descriptionText: The 650S GT3 is an FIA-GT3 regulation ready vehicle developed from the McLaren 650S supercar. While it uses the same 3.8L V8 twin-turbo engine, it has been detuned to meet GT3 regulations, producing the same 493.1 BHP as the MP4-12C GT3. It also features numerous endurance oriented improvements across the car. The 2015 650S GT3 achieved victory at GT Asia the same year and the Bathurst 12 Hour at the start of 2016.

cars.name: McLaren McLaren F1 '94
description: The McLaren F1 is a super sports car devised by Formula 1 designer Gordon Murray. From the 3 seat layout that places the driver in the centre, to the finely tuned weight distribution, this revolutionary model has so many features to write about. It has been lauded by enthusiasts around the globe for being not only the world's fastest supercar but for its usability on a daily basis.

cars.name: McLaren McLaren F1 GTR - BMW '95
description: This racing machine is based on McLaren's first full-scale road car, the F1. At the 1995 24 Hours of Le Mans, the track was plagued with rain for almost the entire day and McLaren managed to pull ahead of open prototype cars who should have had the advantage, claiming overall victory. The winning car No. 59, which had factory support from McLaren, was driven by Yannick Dalmas, Masanori Sekiya, and JJ Lehto.

cars.name: McLaren McLaren P1 GTR '16
description: A circuit-only version of the P1 built to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the F1 GTR race car and its career through the 1990s. The system output of the electric motors and V8 twin-turbo engine has been increased to 986.2 BHP. A large rear wing and other aerodynamic improvements have also been made to optimize its on-track performance.

cars.name: McLaren McLaren VGT
description: The McLaren Ultimate Vision Gran Turismo was developed by McLaren as a vision of 2030 and beyond. Behind the cabin, in which the driver would lay in a motorcycle like position, sits a 4L V8 twin-turbo engine. The engine is aided by high performance electric motors sitting in each of the front wheel 'pods', for a total power output of 1,134.1 BHP.

The engine is aided by high performance electric motors sitting in each of the front wheel 'pods', for a total power output of 1,134.1 BHP.

cars.name: McLaren McLaren VGT (Gr.1)
description: A Gran Turismo Original, this Gr.1 machine is based on the McLaren Ultimate Vision Gran Turismo which was created in a collaboration between McLaren and Gran Turismo. Though active aero parts are restricted under Gr.1 rules, this car still manages to nimbly round corners due to the overwhelming downforce provided by the base body shape and strong mechanical grip.
cars.descriptionText: A Gran Turismo Original, this Gr.1 machine is based on the McLaren Ultimate Vision Gran Turismo which was created in a collaboration between McLaren and Gran Turismo. Though active aero parts are restricted under Gr.1 rules, this car still manages to nimbly round corners due to the overwhelming downforce provided by the base body shape and strong mechanical grip.

cars.name: McLaren MP4-12C '10
description: With the name 'MP4' as if to remind one of its parallels with F1 machines, the McLaren MP4-12C is notable for its carbon-composite 'MonoCell' tub. This feature contributes greatly to the weight reduction of the vehicle, which while having somewhat modest power specifications for a McLaren road car, still manages to match or perhaps even exceed the performance of its rival, the Ferrari 458 Italia.
