cars.name: Suzuki Cappuccino '91
description: The Cappuccino is a kei category sports car released by Suzuki in November 1991. Along with the Honda Beat and Mazda's Autozam AZ-1 it was a part of the 2-seater kei sports boom. The Cappuccino features a long-nosed 2-seater convertible body equipped with a front-mounted 63.1 BHP engine, the most powerful spec under kei regulations. With a 51:49 front-to-rear weight distribution, there is no doubt that this is a true rear-wheel drive sports car.

cars.name: Suzuki Carry KC '12
description: Japan's micro-car segment, known domestically as kei cars, has become an essential part of daily life across the country. The Suzuki Carry compact truck is a quintessential example of the subcategory of commercial kei cars which features a wide variety of cargo vans and trucks. The Carry has a long history, being originally introduced in 1961. The version featured here is the 2012 model, the final iteration of the 10th generation. Thanks to its charming looks and practicality, the Carry has recently also found an audience overseas.

cars.name: Suzuki Jimny Sierra JC '18
description: This 3-door model of the Jimny has been lengthened and widened to fit the international market. The part-time four-wheel drive system with mechanical transfer case is now mated to a 1,460 cc inline-4 DOHC engine, achieving unwavering off-road ability. This 3rd generation JB74 model, counting from the original Sierra, was met with critical acclaim for its square, stretched out styling.

cars.name: Suzuki Jimny XC '18
description: Japan's micro off-roader. Since its initial introduction in the 1970s, the Jimny has always used a kei regulation ladder frame construction with four-wheel drive rigid axle suspension and large diameter tyres. 2018 saw the release of the square bodied 4th generation model which has found use not only a leisure vehicle, but as a working car in mountainous regions as well.

cars.name: Suzuki SUZUKI VGT
description: The SUZUKI Vision Gran Turismo utilises the latest engine from the 'Hayabusa' sports bike, along with the latest electrification and weight reduction technologies. The powertrain uses the 1,340 cm³ engine of the Hayabusa along with 3 high-power electric motors in an all-wheel drive configuration. The engine and motors combined provide a total output of 426 BHP at 9,700 rpm, making this a compact super sports machine.

cars.name: Suzuki Swift Sport '07
description: The Suzuki Swift Sport is a sports model based on the 2nd generation Swift. The engine is a naturally aspirated 1.6L unit tuned for high rpms and featuring both forged pistons and VVT. Minor changes in 2007 took the rev limit up from 7000rpm to 7500rpm, and with a close-ratio 5-speed manual transmission it provides an even more exciting drive.

cars.name: Suzuki Swift Sport '17
description: The Swift Sport is a sports model of the 4th generation Suzuki Swift, introduced in 2016. The aerodynamic body is equipped with a tuned downsized 1.4L turbo engine running on high-octane fuel. The suspension has also been specially tuned to improve handling. It should also be noted that this model is 70 kg lighter than the previous Swift Sport model.

cars.name: Suzuki Swift Sport Gr.4
description: A Gr.4 version of the 'KATANA Edition' concept model, which combines the ZC33 model Swift Sport with the beauty and power of the KATANA sports bike. The front under spoiler has been extended and a GT style wing has been added. Along with different sized tyres, interior weight reduction, and a roll cage, the car has evolved into a Gran Turismo Gr.4 spec race machine.

cars.name: Suzuki V6 Escudo Pikes Peak Special '98
description: The Pikes Peak International Hill Climb is the world's largest hill climb race, spanning a gruelling distance of 12.4 miles and an elevation difference of 1,439 m. The Suzuki V6 Escudo Pikes Peak Special was developed especially for this race and features a midship mounted 981.3 BHP 2.5L V6 twin-turbo engine. Thanks to its lightweight and excellent aerodynamics, Nobuhiro Tajima became the first Japanese driver to achieve overall victory at the event in 1995.

cars.name: Tesla Model 3 Performance '23
description: The Tesla Model 3 is a compact battery EV sedan. The most powerful model in the lineup is the Performance Dual Motor AWD grade, which is capable of a 0-62.1 mph time of 3.3s and a top speed of 162.2 mph. Under WLTP testing, international standard for electrical and fuel efficiency, the car boasts a maximum range of 339.9 miles. In 2023, it would receive its first major update, featuring changes to the front mask, length and controls.

cars.name: Tesla Model S Signature Performance '12
description: The second model produced by EV giant Tesla after their Roadster. The large sedan body features a rear hatch, making it a 5-door. Three different battery sizes were available according to the price point. The top grade Signature Performance model produces 410.3 BHP/61.0 kgfm putting it on the level of supercars.

cars.name: Toyota 2000GT '67
description: Debuting in 1967, the Toyota 2000GT is a dream car for many, with its design, engineering and performance all exceeding the expectations of enthusiasts at the time. The car also took numerous victories at the circuit and set a world record when it reached 136.7 mph on the Yatabe test course. Its popularity reached around the world, even reaching the silver screen when it served as the Bond car in 'You Only Live Twice.'

cars.name: Toyota 86 Gr.4
description: A Gran Turismo original, this version of Toyota's new standard sports model, the '86', has been modified to meet Gr.4 regulations. Though the 86 has already competed in clubman races around the world, this version has been turned into a true race car, with its power output increased to 364 horsepower. This machine excels in the corners where it can use its light compact body to its full advantage.

cars.name: Toyota 86 Gr.B Rally Car
description: A Gran Turismo original, this version of Toyota's new standard sports model, the '86', has been modified to meet Gr.B regulations. The car has been transformed into a top class rally car with the rear-wheel drive of the base model converted to a four-wheel drive layout and the canards and 2-level rear wing producing a strong downforce.

cars.name: Toyota 86 GRMN '16
description: Only available to order over the internet starting on January 2016, the 86 GRMN was a complete tuned car built by Toyota, based on their popular 86 sports car. In addition to structural reinforcements, the centre of gravity was lowered through the use of lightweight materials. The car features a number of other modifications; power output has been increased of course, but it also features a new close ratio 6-speed manual transmission as well as stronger brakes and different size tyres for the front and rear.

cars.name: Toyota 86 GT '15
description: The Toyota 86 is the Toyota version of the compact front-engine, rear-wheel drive sports car developed jointly with Subaru. The front-midship mounted naturally aspirated 2L DOHC boxer engine produces 197.2 BHP/20 kgfm. Many new parts were designed and developed specifically for this vehicle, resulting in direct handling that makes the driver feel at one with the car. This is truly a new generation lightweight sports car that puts car fans first.

cars.name: Toyota 86 GT"Limited" '16
description: Released in 2012, the Toyota 86 is a sports car which combines a compact body with a rear-wheel drive layout. The first minor update in 2016 would improve body rigidity and aerodynamics. 6-speed manual models would also receive an engine tune and improvements for many other parts, emphasising performance over appearance. This 'GT Limited' model is the highest grade in the 86 lineup. The interior features high-quality materials like leather and Alcantara for an overall more mature appearance.

cars.name: Toyota Alphard Executive Lounge '18
description: Since the introduction of the original model in 2002, the Toyota Alphard has constantly strived to provide the definitive luxury minivan. The 3rd generation Alphard, introduced in 2015, added the 'Executive Lounge' luxury upgrade which provides the utmost in comfort for the 2nd row seats. It provided more luxury and comfort than ever before. In 2017, a facelift model was released which provided an update to the 4.5L V6 engine along with further improving comfort.

cars.name: Toyota Aqua S '11
description: After popularizing hybrid cars with the release of the Prius, Toyota developed the Aqua, a smaller, even more economical hybrid car. The hybrid system is a lightened version of that seen in the 3rd generation Prius. In Japanese standard JC08 mode fuel economy tests, it achieved a maximum of 2.9 l/100 km. Outside of Japan it was released as the Prius C.

cars.name: Toyota C-HR S '18
description: Following a number of internationally-oriented models like the Corolla and Yaris, in 2016, Toyota introduced the C-HR crossover SUV which was developed as a new global car for the 21st century. This unconventional SUV also displayed aspirations as a sports car with a prototype model appearing in the Nürburgring 24 Hours. The body uses the new-generation TNGA platform, equipped with either a 1.8L hybrid unit, or a 1.2L inline-4 turbo engine. The C-HR would find widespread support, becoming a bestseller.

cars.name: Toyota Celica GT-FOUR (ST205) '94
description: The 6th generation Toyota Celica was introduced in October 1993. The futuristic stylings of the Celica were further clarified with its quad round headlights, while changes like the larger body strengthened its image as a front-wheel drive speciality car. In 1994, the GT-FOUR (ST205) was introduced as a WRC base car. The 3S-GTE 2L turbo engine has been tuned to produce 251.5 BHP.

cars.name: Toyota Celica GT-FOUR Rally Car (ST205) '95
description: The ST185 model Celica earned Toyota a double victory in the 1993 WRC, winning both the makes and drivers titles. In 1994, the new ST205 was introduced, hoping for another victory. However, in the 7th round at Catalonia, the Celica was found to have violated engine regulations and was stripped of all points for the season. Toyota reacted to the decision by pulling out of the WRC, ending the ST205's career after just one season. Although it only had a short run, the car's gallant looks earned it numerous fans.

cars.name: Toyota Corolla Levin 1600GT APEX (AE86) '83
description: Introduced in 1983, this is the 4th generation Corolla Levin. It carries over the floor panel from the previous TE71 and is the only model of its generation to retain the rear-wheel drive layout, while all other Corollas were front-wheel drive. The 1.6L 4A-GEU DOHC engine and lightweight body make for a responsive driving feel. Once production ended, the demand for affordable rear-wheel drive cars only grew, cementing its position as one of the greatest sports models produced by Toyota.

cars.name: Toyota Crown Athlete G '13
description: The Toyota Crown received a full model change in 2012 to become its 14th generation model with a new front mask. The lineup featured a more reserved 'Royal' version and a sporty 'Athlete' version. The Royal model used a crown as a design motif, while the Athlete has a sharper look with themes of lightning bolts. This created a whole new look while retaining the key concepts of previous models.

cars.name: Toyota Crown Athlete G Safety Car
description: The Toyota Crown received a full model change in 2012 to become its 14th generation model with a new front mask. The lineup featured a more reserved 'Royal' version and a sporty 'Athlete' version. 4 different power units were available across the whole series: a 3.5L V6, a 2.5L V6, a 2.5L inline-4 hybrid or a 2L inline-4 turbo. This safety car version is a Gran Turismo Original design.

cars.name: Toyota FT-1
description: The Toyota FT-1 is a concept model by Toyota's North American design base CALTY Design, which offers a look at one possible direction for the future of Toyota sports car design. The projected dimensions are Length: 4,675 mm, Width: 1,970 mm, Height: 1,225 mm, Wheelbase: 2,740 mm. The design evokes the long tradition of Toyota sports models which started with the Toyota 2000GT.

cars.name: Toyota FT-1 VGT
description: The FT-1 Vision Gran Turismo is a racing version of Toyota's FT-1 sports design concept, created by their North American design base CALTY Design. The design is based on extensive use of both data and experience, featuring oversized fenders, an enlarged air intake, and a large rear wing as well as front canards.

cars.name: Toyota FT-1 VGT (Gr.3)
description: This Gran Turismo Original is a Gr.3 specification version of Toyota's new-generation racing concept, the FT-1 Vision Gran Turismo. The base FT-1 has been fitted with wide fenders, a large rear wing and a front splitter to transform it into a cutting edge race car.
cars.descriptionText: This Gran Turismo Original is a Gr.3 specification version of Toyota's new-generation racing concept, the FT-1 Vision Gran Turismo. The base FT-1 has been fitted with wide fenders, a large rear wing and a front splitter to transform it into a cutting edge race car.

cars.name: Toyota GR Corolla MORIZO Edition '22
description: The GR Corolla is a hot hatch created by Toyota's 'GR' high performance brand to topple its rivals in performance. While this is already the most powerful car in Corolla history, an even more extreme 'MORIZO Edition' was produced. While the automotive world looks towards electrification and intelligent systems, the GR Corolla is a rare example of the simple charms of the internal combustion engine.

cars.name: Toyota GR Supra Race Car '19
description: The rebirth of a Toyota flagship sports car lost for 17 years, the GR Supra carries over the classic rear-wheel drive layout and straight six engine in a new 2-seater package with an advanced body and twin-scroll turbocharger. It made its Nürburgring 24 Hours debut in 2018, competed in the SP8T class in 2019, completing the race 3rd in class, 41st overall. This solidified the GR Supra's image as a fighting sports car.

cars.name: Toyota GR Supra Racing Concept '18
description: The GR Supra Racing Concept is a concept model that revives the Toyota Supra as a race car, 16 years after production had ceased in 2002. The 2-door coupé's compact body, which has the traditional long nose, short deck sports car proportions, uses cutting-edge materials and engineering to create superior aerodynamics and handling.

cars.name: Toyota GR Supra RZ '19
description: The Toyota Supra was reintroduced in 2019 after having been discontinued in 2002. This new Supra carries over the straight six engine, rear-wheel drive setup of its predecessor, pursuing the ideals of a pure sports car. It boasts an ideal body balance, with a 50:50 front-to-rear weight distribution and low centre of gravity. The twin-scroll turbo provides excellent acceleration, while the wide body and short wheelbase provide agile handling, resulting in a very attractive package.

cars.name: Toyota GR Yaris RZ "High performance" '20
description: Developed by Toyota to compete in the WRC, the GR Yaris appears to be a simple compact car but is actually a powerful racing machine. Rigidity has been increased, body weight has been reduced and the centre of gravity has been lowered as far as possible. The four-wheel drive RZ model features a 1.6L 3-cylinder turbo engine with a 6-speed manual transmission. The 'RZ High performance' further adds an LSD to provide rocksteady traction. In January 2020, the '1st Edition' was introduced as special edition model.
cars.descriptionText: Developed by Toyota to compete in the WRC, the GR Yaris appears to be a simple compact car but is actually a powerful racing machine. Rigidity has been increased, body weight has been reduced and the centre of gravity has been lowered as far as possible. The four-wheel drive RZ model features a 1.6L 3-cylinder turbo engine with a 6-speed manual transmission. The 'RZ High performance' further adds an LSD to provide rocksteady traction. In January 2020, the '1st Edition' was introduced as special edition model.

cars.name: Toyota GR010 HYBRID '21
description: The TOYOTA GR010 HYBRID 2021 is a successor to the TS050, developed to meet new regulations introduced in 2021. The engine has been changed to a 3.5L V6 twin-turbo unit (670.6 BHP) in a four-wheel drive layout with a 268.2 BHP electric motor located in the front of the vehicle. Driver teams which included Kamui Kobayashi and Kazuki Nakajima would go on to win all 6 rounds of the WEC season including Le Mans, marking the start of the hypercar era.

cars.name: Toyota GR86 RZ '21
description: Toyota's lightweight, front-engine rear-wheel drive sports car, named '86', was introduced in 2012 and sold over 200,000 units worldwide. 9 years since its release, the car was reborn as the 'GR86', featuring a larger 2.4L naturally aspirated 4-cylinder DOHC boxer engine producing 231.8 BHP and 25.5 kgfm maximum torque. With improvements to body rigidity and weight reduction, along with a new aerodynamic design created from motorsports feedback, this car is more fun to drive than ever before.

With improvements to body rigidity and weight reduction, along with a new aerodynamic design created from motorsports feedback, this car is more fun to drive than ever before.

cars.name: Toyota GT-One (TS020) '99
description: In 1998, Toyota developed the GT-One (TS020) with the goal of winning at the 24 Hours of Le Mans. Designed by André de Cortanze, the GT-One features aerodynamics and suspension derived from F1. In 1998, troubles left the team without a result, however in 1999 the GT-One was evolved into an LM GTP car. Ukyo Katayama's team came in 2nd overall, the highest result in Le Mans history for a team of Japanese drivers.

cars.name: Toyota Hiace Van DX '16
description: The Hiace is the representative model of Toyota's commercial vehicles, finding support all over the world. Introduced in 2004 and constantly updated since, the 5th generation H200 model has become a record-setting long seller. The H200 is available in a number of grades according to body size, and is available with either a 2L or 2.7L petrol engine, or a 2.8L diesel engine. The Van DX is the standard roof height model with 2-wheel, rear-wheel drive. It is able of seating a maximum of 9 people, or the seats can be folded down to create a large cargo space.

cars.name: Toyota Himedic '21
description: From the 1950s, Toyota has produced ambulances made from specially outfitted passenger and commercial vehicles. The latest of these is the third-generation 'Himedic' high-standard ambulance introduced in 2006. The body is based on the 200 Series HiAce Super Long. With additions over the previous model such as the implementation of a larger patient area, this car has been designed with the utmost functionality in a lifesaving situation.

cars.name: Toyota Land Cruiser FJ40V '74
description: Offering outstanding all-terrain performance and reliability, the Land Cruiser has become the world's favourite off-road vehicle. Introduced in 1960, the 3rd generation '40' model also provides a comfortable on-road experience. The 2-door hard-top model featured here houses a 3.9L F-model petrol engine, mated to a part-time four-wheel drivetrain. However, its popularity grew even further in 1974 with the addition of a 3L B-model diesel engine. The series would prove to be a massive hit, remaining in production until 1984.

cars.name: Toyota MR2 GT-S '97
description: Released in 1989, the 2nd generation MR2, also known as the SW20, was the successor to Japan's first mass-produced midship, the AW11. Body dimensions were pushed to the limit of Japanese class 5 vehicle size limits, and in contrast to the original featured new rounder, streamlined stylings to express its midship layout. At its debut, the car came under fire for its difficult handling, but later updates would turn it into a well balanced mid-engine sports car.

cars.name: Toyota Prius G '09
description: The 3rd generation model Prius, the byword for hybrid cars. This model aims to improve not only environmental performance, but driving pleasure. The new body has been given a sharp aerodynamic form that exudes a feeling of speed. The engine has not only been enlarged to 1.8L, over 90% of the hybrid system has been replaced with newly developed parts. In fuel efficiency, the car is able to reach an astounding 2.7 l/100 km bringing a new quality to the world of driving, the joy of fuel efficiency.

cars.name: Toyota RAV4 Adventure '20
description: When it was introduced in 1994, the Toyota RAV4 pioneered a new market segment known as 'the crossover SUV.' Featuring a compact body with high ground clearance, this model won followers around the world, entering its 5th generation in 2018. The Adventure grade offers rugged off-road styling, and features a custom grille and skid-plate bumpers, along with 19-inch wheel rims. The 2L inline-4 Dynamic Force Engine is coupled to a Direct Shift-CVT to offer both smooth acceleration and high fuel efficiency.

cars.name: Toyota S-FR '15
description: With its concept of providing 'perfect control in an entry model, allowing the driver to enjoy interacting with the car in its everyday use', Toyota introduced the S-FR lightweight sportscar in the autumn of 2015 at the Tokyo Motor Show. The design captures the essence of the classic Toyota Sports 800 updated for modern tastes.

cars.name: Toyota S-FR Racing Concept '16
description: Introduced at the 2015 Tokyo Motor Show, the S-FR Racing Concept was a racing version of the Toyota S-FR. Fender width was increased by 20 mm each side and a large air outlet was added on the engine bonnet. A large spoiler and other ground effects have also been added, giving the once cute S-FR Concept the image of a full GT racing machine.

cars.name: Toyota Sports 800 '65
description: The Toyota Sports 800, nicknamed the 'Yota-Hachi,' is a compact sports car with a fixed B-pillar type removable roof panel (or Targa top.) Aluminium and acrylic parts have been used extensively throughout out the body, reducing weight to just 580 kg. The 750 cc engine produces just 44.4 BHP but its light weight allows it to reach a top speed of 96.3 mph, which was as fast as many 1,500 cc class cars of its time.

cars.name: Toyota Sprinter Trueno 1600GT APEX (AE86) '83
description: The Corolla/Sprinter largely moved over to a front-wheel drive layout in 1983, with the single exception being the rear-wheel drive AE86 model Corolla Levin/Sprinter Trueno, otherwise known as the 'Hachi-Roku'. The body was available as a 3-door hatchback or a 2-door notchback. The engine was a newly developed 1.6L 4A-GEU inline-4 DOHC unit. There were rivals which boasted similar specs, but the Hachi-Roku is still loved by car enthusiasts to this day for its fun and satisfying handling.

cars.name: Toyota Sprinter Trueno 1600GT APEX (S.Shigeno Version)
description: This car is the Trueno owned by Shuichi Shigeno, author of the popular 'Initial D' manga which heavily features the 'Hachi-Roku' AE86 model Levin/Trueno. Equipped with an HKS exhaust manifold and Trust silencer, the engine is now capable of producing 207.1 BHP. The car has also been equipped with a TRD suspension kit, allowing for agile footwork and high cornering speeds.

cars.name: Toyota Supra 3.0GT Turbo A '88
description: Originally a variant of the Celica, the XX became a model of its own in February 1986 when it debuted as the Supra. Among the grade models available, the most popular was the high performance 3.0GT Turbo A, a model made for championship homologation which featured the 266.3 BHP 7M-GTEU 3L turbo engine. In addition it had a wider body equal to the North American spec model at 1,745 mm, as well as reinforced suspension.

cars.name: Toyota Supra GT500 '97
description: The All Japan Grand Touring Championship (JGTC) was held until 2004, before it became the current 'Super GT' series. The Toyota Supra began competition in the JGTC in 1994. At the time, the series was dominated by the Nissan Skyline GT-R, but in 1997, the Supra would finally rip the season title away from the GT-R. That historic car is this No. 36 Castrol TOM'S Supra.

cars.name: Toyota Supra RZ '97
description: In May 1993, the Toyota Supra was reborn, leaving the long nose behind for a new glamorous muscular form. The 3 litre DOHC twin turbo model with the famed 2JZ engine produced 276.1 BHP, with the highest grade model featuring a six-speed manual transmission and Bilstein suspension. It also featured structural reinforcements as well as tuned dampers and bushings to create a much more manageable beast.

cars.name: Toyota TS030 Hybrid '12
description: The TS030 Hybrid was developed for competition in the 2012 World Endurance Championship. The 'THS-R' powertrain was developed in a joint effort between Toyota's production hybrid development team and the Higashi-Fuji Technical Center's motorsports division using a newly designed V8 engine. It was unfortunately forced to retire in its debut race at the 24 Hours of Le Mans but it took 3 victories over the season, finishing 2nd in the rankings.

cars.name: Toyota TS050 - Hybrid '16
description: The TS050 - Hybrid was developed to compete in the 2016 World Endurance Championship. The car features MGUs on the front and rear axles along with a V6 direct injection twin-turbo engine. The combined power output of the engine and electric motors is 986.2 BHP. The car appeared to be a contender for the drivers title but ultimately finished 3rd in the rankings. It also finished 3rd in the manufacturers rankings.

cars.name: Toyota Tundra TRD Pro '19
description: The Tundra is a full-size pickup truck developed by Toyota for the North American market. Introduced in 2015, the TRD Pro is a 5.7L V8 equipped 4x4 tuned by Toyota's motorsports division, TRD. The suspension has been tuned, adding Fox dampers, while a newly designed bonnet scoop and BBS wheels add to its sporty looks.

cars.name: TVR Tuscan Speed 6 '00
description: Introduced in 2000 by sports car builder TVR, this 2-door coupé features a detachable roof and an interesting curved yet aggressive exterior design. The engine is an in-house developed 4L inline-6 dubbed the 'Speed 6' producing 359 BHP, and with a body weight of just 1,100 kg this car is capable of absurd performance.

cars.name: Volkswagen Beetle Gr.3
description: The Beetle Gr.3 is a racing version of Volkswagen's iconic compact, the Beetle, modified to meet Gr.3 specifications. The adorable base car has been aggressively transformed into top class race car, with extensive modifications like changing the drivetrain from front to rear-wheel drive, and lowering the roof to decrease the front cross-sectional area.

cars.name: Volkswagen Golf I GTI '83
description: The Volkswagen Golf was released in 1974 and found great popularity as the forerunner of the compact car. The 'GTI' sport model was equipped with a 1.6L inline-4 SOHC engine using of Bosch fuel injectors which was able to produce 108.5 BHP. The GTI combined high performance with practicality, rewriting the rules for sports driving.

The GTI combined high performance with practicality, rewriting the rules for sports driving.

cars.name: Volkswagen Golf VII GTI '14
description: Debuting in 2012, the 7th generation Volkswagen Golf was built on a new platform allowing for various improvements. Most notably, handling was improved with the use of the 'XDS', an electronically controlled differential locking mechanism that works much the same as an LSD, 'DCC' adaptive chassis control, and progressive steering. These improvements increase stability as well as allowing the car to take corners at much higher speeds.

cars.name: Volkswagen GTI Roadster VGT
description: The 'GTI Roadster Vision Gran Turismo' is a supercar that carries the DNA of Volkswagen's 'GTI' experience. At its heart is a 3L twin-turbo VR6 TSI engine producing 502 BHP/67 kgfm. That power is directed through a 7-speed dual-clutch transmission to both front and back wheels for unbeatable traction and acceleration.

cars.name: Volkswagen GTI Supersport VGT
description: The 'GTI Supersport Vision Gran Turismo' takes DNA from the legends in Volkswagen's GTI history to create a both technically and visually refined supercar. The body, which evokes the image of the iconic Golf, mounts a 502 BHP VR6 TSI engine. With a lowered centre of gravity utilising lightweight parts, the car provides a superior handling experience.

cars.name: Volkswagen ID.R '19
description: Volkswagen's prototype race car is a role model for carbon reduction. The carbon fibre body features large wings at the front and rear of the car, and is equipped with 2 electric motors driving the front and rear axles. It also boasts stunning performance, setting incredible times on Pikes Peak, the Nürburgring Nordschleife, and Goodwood.

cars.name: Volkswagen Polo GTI '14
description: A high performance version of the 5th gen Polo, Volkswagen's masterpiece compact car. Originally equipped with a 1.4L engine with a super- and turbocharger, the 2014 model changed to a 1.8L turbocharged unit, achieving both high output at 189.3 BHP and better fuel efficiency. With performance befitting the GTI badge, this car is a worthy representative of B-segment hot hatches.

cars.name: Volkswagen Sambabus Typ 2 '62
description: Dr. Ferdinand Porsche's Volkswagen was developed into a wide range of variants. One of which was the Sambabus, which transformed the car into a van with a large luggage space. By mounting the horizontally-opposed engine at the very back of the vehicle, it was possible to create a wide and low floor space while maintaining the compact size. This versatility gave the model a number of advantages as a commercial vehicle.

cars.name: Volkswagen Scirocco Gr.4
description: A Gran Turismo Original, Volkswagen's stylish Scirocco sports car has been modified to meet Gr.4 standards. The aero parts are relatively understated with a small front splitter and rear wing, but this car aims to utilize the high performance present in the base model, with a cornering ability that exceeds most front-wheel drive cars.

cars.name: Volkswagen Scirocco R '10
description: The Scirocco R is a high performance sports coupé developed from the basic components of the Golf. The body uses a low ride height and wide track width, and has been equipped with special bumpers, side skirts and a roof spoiler. Major upgrades have also been made to the suspension and brakes. Lighter than the Golf R introduced in the same era, this car has been polished up as a fleet-footed high spec sports model.

Lighter than the Golf R introduced in the same era, this car has been polished up as a fleet-footed high spec sports model.

cars.name: Volkswagen Volkswagen 1200 '66
description: Often known by its nicknames such as the 'Beetle', the Volkswagen Type I was a rear-wheel drive vehicle with an air-cooled 4-cylinder engine mounted in the rear. Produced from 1938 to 2003, over 21,000,000 cars were produced. The Volkswagen 1200 is the official name for model produced between the mid 1950s and late 1960s which featured a 1.2L engine.

cars.name: Volkswagen Volkswagen GTI VGT (Gr.3)
description: This Gran Turismo Original is a Gr.3 specification version of the GTI Vision Gran Turismo, itself produced in a collaboration between Volkswagen and Gran Turismo. Major improvements have been made to downforce with a longer front splitter and an enlarged rear wing.
cars.descriptionText: This Gran Turismo Original is a Gr.3 specification version of the GTI Vision Gran Turismo, itself produced in a collaboration between Volkswagen and Gran Turismo. Major improvements have been made to downforce with a longer front splitter and an enlarged rear wing.

cars.name: Volvo 240 SE Estate '93
description: The 240 Estate was the car that cemented the image of Volvo as a station wagon manufacturer. The greatest appeal of the car is its square angles and elongated proportions. Other points include its simple, uniquely Scandinavian interior and its soft sofa style seats. Though many years have passed since the end of its production, this car still is still cherished by many as an everyday car, something that is quite rare among classics.

cars.name: Volvo V40 T5 R-Design '13
description: The V40 is a 5-door hatchback model in the C-segment. Taking design cues from Volvo classics of the 1960s, like the P1800 and 1800ES, the flowing lines of its silhouette can be interpreted as either a coupé or a wagon. The T5 R-Design is the most sporty model in the series lineup. The 2L inline-5 turbo engine produced 210.1 BHP while the sports suspension and 18-inch wheels provide sharp yet smooth handling.

cars.name: Wicked Fabrication Wicked Fabrication GT 51
description: The 'Gran Turismo Award' is given to the based custom cars on display at SEMA. In 2016, the 14th such award was given to the Wicked Fabrications GT 51, built from a 1951 Ford Custom Club Coupe by a team of customisation specialists for former racing driver Bruce Leven. The work took an estimated 10,000 hours to complete.

cars.name: Xiaomi SU7 Ultra '25
description: The Xiaomi SU7 Ultra is an extreme performance version of the SU7 sports saloon, the debut car from smart device maker Xiaomi. The all-wheel drive system, which uses 3 electric motors spread across the front and rear axles, boasts a total system output of 1,526.6 BHP. The 'V8' model motors located on the rear axle are the most powerful in any production car, able to rotate at speeds of up to 27,200 rpm. Additionally, extensive aerodynamic development has resulted in the car being able to produce up to 285 kg of downforce.
cars.descriptionText: The Xiaomi SU7 Ultra is an extreme performance version of the SU7 sports saloon, the debut car from smart device maker Xiaomi. The all-wheel drive system, which uses 3 electric motors spread across the front and rear axles, boasts a total system output of 1,526.6 BHP. The 'V8' model motors located on the rear axle are the most powerful in any production car, able to rotate at speeds of up to 27,200 rpm. Additionally, extensive aerodynamic development has resulted in the car being able to produce up to 285 kg of downforce.

cars.name: Zagato IsoRivolta Zagato VGT
description: This Vision Gran Turismo was created by Carrozzeria Zagato, taking inspiration from the IsoRivolta, a GT car from the 1960s produced by sports car brand ISO. This car takes the DNA of the IsoRivolta, which saw extensive use in motorsports, and rebuilds it using the latest design techniques and technologies.
